ti sentirai da subito parte della squadra, supportato nel proporre le tue idee e visioni

3930439525,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-prima-3930439525?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=ljxJxtm33u23GUA0GVoD7w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Prima,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Is it a thrilling opportunity in a dynamic environment which is constantly evolving what you are currently looking for?

Are you curious to see how a company that operates in the Insurance sector provides a great experience at a great price to its customers using cutting-edge technologies to create and sell its products? Then, we are happy to inform you that you have just got a ticket to the fast lane!

IT technology lies at the very core of everything we do and our Engineering and Product departments are composed by passionate and innovative people who never stop learning and developing their skills employing the latest stacks and methodologies.
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development.
We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

As a Data Analyst you will join the global Product Analytics team and play a pivotal role in transforming big data into actionable insights that can steer strategic business decisions all across the organization. You will work closely with stakeholders in Product, Engineering and Business teams to identify analytics opportunities, to understand the main quantitative factors that are influencing the company's performance and results, in order to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
In particular, this position is focused on the analytical support to the Claims domain.
Analyse big amount of data in claims domain, distil insights, and make recommendations to drive product and business decisions
Improve stakeholder productivity and experience by identifying blockers and new efficiency opportunities
Assist Product teams in developing Data Model and Data Products according to the company's data strategy
Perform ad-hoc analyses to examine specific phenomena or validate business strategies
You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:
Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Maths, Data Science, Economics or related fields
High-level analytical, logical, and quantitative problem-solving skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and Excel
Knowledge of BI tools such as Tableau
In addition to the basic requirements, we will pay special attention to these characteristics:
Experience in manipulating and interpreting data from different sources
Experience in working in IT departments

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.
If it sounds like we‚Äôd be a good fit for each other, join us in the fast lane!

IT technology lies at the very core of everything we do and our Engineering and Product departments are composed by passionate and innovative people who never stop learning and developing their skills employing the latest stacks and methodologies.

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career

learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development.

We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column3:
so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will join the global Product Analytics team and play a pivotal role in transforming big data into actionable insights that can steer strategic business decisions all across the organization. You will work closely with stakeholders in Product, Engineering and Business teams to identify analytics opportunities, to understand the main quantitative factors that are influencing the company's performance and results, in order to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

In particular, this position is focused on the analytical support to the Claims domain.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyse big amount of data in claims domain, distil insights, and make recommendations to drive product and business decisions
  • Improve stakeholder productivity and experience by identifying blockers and new efficiency opportunities
  • Assist Product teams in developing Data Model and Data Products according to the company's data strategy
  • Perform ad-hoc analyses to examine specific phenomena or validate business strategies

Requirements

  • You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:
  • Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Maths, Data Science, Economics or related fields
  • High-level analytical, logical, and quantitative problem-solving skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and Excel

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of BI tools such as Tableau
  • In addition to the basic requirements, we will pay special attention to these characteristics:
  • Experience in manipulating and interpreting data from different sources
  • Experience in working in IT departments

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

If it sounds like we‚Äôd be a good fit for each other, join us in the fast lane!

3977345312,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-business-intelligence-at-gruppo-feltrinelli-3977345312?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=oC9xEX3QIR2WFi615d%2FPyw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Analista business intelligence,Gruppo Feltrinelli,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Per il nostro Gruppo cerchiamo una figura di Business Analyst che operer√† all‚Äôinterno della unit√† di Business Intelligence, a supporto in particolare del settore Retail Omnichannel.
Elaborare e analizzare dati di business (come vendite, KPIs, ST%, coverage e altri parametri chiave) utilizzando i tools di analisi di dati
Analizzare in modo proattivo e costante il trend per identificare punti critici / definire action plan
Sviluppo di nuovi standard reports su base weekly e monthly per valutare performance vs target e per supportare i diversi team ed il personale dei negozi
Fornire Executive summary e report ad-hoc in base ai trend del mercato, con informazioni rilevanti per il business e feedback qualitativi
Monitorare livelli di stock e copertura per garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di vendita e di sell-thru
Indagine delle attuali metriche utilizzate o mancanti, in funzione dello sviluppo del nuovo sistema BI
Lavoro a stretto contatto con IT per l‚Äôimplementazione del nuovo sistema di BI
Ricerca di eventuali data issues in collaborazione con IT ed i relativi partner commerciali allo scopo di avere dati consistenti a tutti I livelli

As a Data Analyst in our Onboarding domain, you will support decision-making in our product development processes to enhance the efficiency of our Customer Due Diligence teams and ensure a smooth onboarding experience for Mollie‚Äôs customers. You will also provide actionable insights or help product teams extract insights themselves using our self-serve reporting tools.

You will work closely alongside the domain‚Äôs leadership team and software engineers to ensure we collect and store the right data. Then working alongside other data professionals, you‚Äôll build robust data models, perform in-depth analyses and tell compelling stories to steer our product teams in the right direction.
Product development: work closely with the domain leadership team and engineers to make sure our products synthesise the data required to measure product performance.
Product analytics: dive deep into frontend / behavioural event data to identify friction points, growth opportunities and other potential product levers.
Data modelling: transform data from different sources into clean, robust, performant, easy to use data models based on the analytical needs of your stakeholders.
Data storytelling: turn your insights into compelling stories and share them via presentations, blog posts, memos, dashboards, workshops, or whatever works best!
Business Intelligence: build and maintain robust, performant data models (dbt + Looker) to empower your stakeholders to report their most important product KPIs.
Craft development: contribute to the evolution of the data analytics craft by sharing your insights, challenges and being a vocal member of the community.
3+ years experience as data analyst or data scientist using data to drive product success
Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
Proactive, pragmatic and have a ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
Fluency in SQL (we use BigQuery) and experience with dbt
Experience working with a BI tool (we use Looker)
Experience with A/B testing and experimentation
Experience with R, Python, or other programming languages

Your opportunity

As a Data Analyst in our Onboarding domain, you will support decision-making in our product development processes to enhance the efficiency of our Customer Due Diligence teams and ensure a smooth onboarding experience for Mollie‚Äôs customers. You will also provide actionable insights or help product teams extract insights themselves using our self-serve reporting tools.

You will work closely alongside the domain‚Äôs leadership team and software engineers to ensure we collect and store the right data. Then working alongside other data professionals, you‚Äôll build robust data models, perform in-depth analyses and tell compelling stories to steer our product teams in the right direction.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Product development: work closely with the domain leadership team and engineers to make sure our products synthesise the data required to measure product performance.
  • Product analytics: dive deep into frontend / behavioural event data to identify friction points, growth opportunities and other potential product levers.
  • Data modelling: transform data from different sources into clean, robust, performant, easy to use data models based on the analytical needs of your stakeholders.
  • Data storytelling: turn your insights into compelling stories and share them via presentations, blog posts, memos, dashboards, workshops, or whatever works best!
  • Business Intelligence: build and maintain robust, performant data models (dbt + Looker) to empower your stakeholders to report their most important product KPIs.
  • Craft development: contribute to the evolution of the data analytics craft by sharing your insights, challenges and being a vocal member of the community.

What You Have

  • 3+ years experience as data analyst or data scientist using data to drive product success
  • Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proactive, pragmatic and have a ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude
  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
  • Fluency in SQL (we use BigQuery) and experience with dbt
  • Experience working with a BI tool (we use Looker)
  • Experience working with Git

Nice to haves

  • Experience with A/B testing and experimentation
  • Experience with R, Python, or other programming languages

A Generali Italia fanno capo Alleanza Assicurazioni, Das, Leone Alato, Genertel, Generali Welion e Generali Jeniot.


    Il Gruppo Generali offre delle interessanti opportunit√† di arricchimento professionale in un contesto lavorativo caratterizzato da:

    • Cultura aziendale solida e aperta, modi di lavorare innovativi, formazione e affiancamento a supporto di un inserimento efficace
    • Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutti si sentano accolti, liberi di esprimere al meglio la propria identit√†, le proprie idee e le proprie capacit√†: perch√© siamo Pi√π che diverse, Persone Uniche
    • Qualit√† dei processi e iniziative per le nostre persone, che ci distinguono come Top Employer


    Entra a far parte della nostra squadra, non esitare a candidarti subito!


    Tipo contratto: Stage

    Modalit√† di lavoro: Hybrid

3942126292,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-stage-at-sennder-3942126292?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=85RJ3mEh%2BdxSE95H8Rn7qQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst Stage,sennder,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","sennder is Europe‚Äôs leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our ""About Us"" presentation.

We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst Intern in the Operations Program & Innovation department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in enhancing real-time visibility and driving advancements in tracking technologies. You will support the management of the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" collaborating with various stakeholders to develop processes aimed at delivering high-quality services to our carriers and shippers. Additionally, you will assist in leading projects focused on visibility and service quality improvements to meet company objectives.
Assist in managing the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" working closely with internal and external stakeholders.
Support the execution of projects aimed at improving our services, contributing to the achievement of company goals.
Assist in the preparation of ad hoc analyses, forecasts, reports, and presentations for senior leadership, providing insights into the effectiveness of outputs.
Aid in building, managing, and maintaining performance reports and dashboards related to key metrics such as GPS coverage, Perfect Service Shipment, and On-Time Performances.
Collaborate with the Product Team to contribute ideas for new solutions, enhancements to existing ones, and draft business requirement documents.
Assist in monitoring and enhancing GPS integration processes of carriers regularly.
Support daily interactions with third-party service providers to enhance real-time visibility.
Serve as a primary point of contact for Operations Teams regarding visibility and service quality matters.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, statistics, or a related field.
At least 1 year of experience in operations management, quality management, performance management, consulting, or similar roles.
Preferred experience in the transportation/logistics industry or familiarity with supply chain visibility concepts.
Proficiency in G-suite and MS Office
column2: SQL skills are a plus.

column1: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and proactively.
Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset.
Fast learner with a collaborative approach to teamwork.

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we‚Äôre growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.
Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000+ people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click here for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.
If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:

Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement & innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.
WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. DRIVE YOUR FUTURE

Are you ready for a new challenge in our E-Commerce & Omnichannel team?:
We are seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to join our team as a Digital Analytics Intern.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on projects related to digital experience analysis and digital data collection, gaining hands-on experience in the field of digital analytics.
What can you learn with us?:
Collaborate to set up and configure the Digital Experience Analytics Platform for effective data tracking and analysis
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key behavioural metrics on a Digital Experience perspective
Measure and analyze user behaviour, engagement, and conversion to optimize user journeys and enhance digital experience.
Work with analytics tools to gather clean and reliable data for actionable insights.
Collaborate with the Digital Analytics team on various projects and tasks as needed, gaining exposure to a wide range of analytics activities (ie: A/B tests, personalization of navigation, etc..)
Generate and present reports on key performance indicators creating visualizations that effectively communicate data insights
Manage and facilitate communication with external agencies to ensure smooth collaboration on analytics-related projects.
Do you have these qualifications and skills?:
Degree in a related field such as Marketing, Business Analytics, or Information Technology
Strong interest in digital analytics and data-driven decision-making
Familiarity with digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics and Decibel or ContentSquare
Knowledge of behavioural analytics concepts and methodologies.

3973687908,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-business-insight-analyst-at-giorgio-armani-3973687908?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=UB%2Fw1lVWXfg%2BshQR2qWwLQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Digital Business Insight Analyst,Giorgio Armani,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione lavoro:

The Armani Group is a leading company in the fashion and luxury sector, with more than 8,000 employees. Its three core brands ‚Äì Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange ‚Äì are active in many countries all over the world. With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Today, therefore, as well as being well known in the area of fashion, the Armani Group is also renowned in the sectors of interior design, food and beverage, and hotels and resorts. Giorgio Armani has created a style that has, with remarkable consistency, continued to explore countless variations and possibilities over the years. It expresses a precise vision down to the most minute detail: a way of being and presenting oneself, certainly incorporating clothing and accessories, but also including gestures, ways, behaviours and attitudes
column2: a style that goes beyond the sum of its parts, and well beyond what one wears. Convinced that ethics and aesthetics must coincide, Giorgio Armani expresses fundamental and enduring values his clothes. He does so by creating timeless pieces that, enhanced by precious materials and artisanal craftwork, resist the whim of fleeting trends with their pure and essential design.

column1: Context and Purpose of the job¬†

Within the Digital Business Unit, you will join the Business Intelligence & CRO Management team. You will play a pivotal role in supporting the team in all the daily analysis regarding E-commerce, identifying and sharing actional insights to different stakeholders.Responsibilities¬†
Process and analyze E-commerce data using data analysis tools to identify actionable insights to maximize online revenue and find new opportunities
Follow deep dive analysis on several business aspects and clearly communicating results to different stakeholders
Conduct standard monthly/weekly/daily reports focusing on brand/region/countries performance
Design, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring the accuracy of the data provided
Support the Digital Team in the extraction of data and creation of ad-hoc analysis
Analyze performance at product level and quantify the impact of promotions both in terms of revenues and business impact
Collaborate with Retail, CRM, Merchandising and Buying team in order to provide comprehensive analysis of different collections/seasons
Provide analysis and interpretation of internal/external market data, highlighting any underlying trends to identify new market opportunities to increase the organization‚Äôs profitability
Keep the Digital Team updated on the latest trends focusing on E-commerce and Competition in the Fashion Industry
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science
Previous experience of 2 years in business analytics, the experience in E-Commerce will be considered a plus
Advanced Excel required, knowledge of Power BI (or other similar Data VisualizationTools) and other BI tools (SAP BO, Microstrategy, ecc).
Analytical skills, organization, proactivity, attention to details, strong communication skills.
We promote diversity and inclusion in all forms, within a collaborative environment where your talent can flourish in the pursuit of a common goal: yours and our growth.

With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa √® CPM, una realt√† internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un‚Äôesperienza che ti metter√† a contatto con i brand e le aziende pi√π importanti in Italia.
Candidati e‚Ä¶ magari ci vediamo a bordo!
Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.
Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacit√† di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perch√© in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualit√† della tua vita.
Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?

3980302297,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-match-digital-3980302297?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=aaQZWxbZ9JwB64VRMos3sg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Match Digital,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.

With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.
Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.
We‚Äôre hiring for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-centric analytical products to develop business intelligence solutions in a transactional retail-tech business.
The Data Analyst will help implement best-in-class corporate reporting tools, reporting into the Corporate Reporting Manager within the Data & Analytics team.
Support with the production of bespoke corporate reports in Tableau and MicroStrategy.
Analyse data for internal stakeholders and analyse & support internal user requests for data and analytics to be deployed into the BI platform.
Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of the business strategy.
Worked as a Data Analyst or BI Analyst with experience developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients.
The ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data.
Advanced knowledge of data visualisation tools - Tableau OR MicroStrategy are a bonus.

Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)

Competitive salary + 10% bonus + benefits

Milan


Our client


Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.


With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.


Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.


The role


We‚Äôre hiring for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-centric analytical products to develop business intelligence solutions in a transactional retail-tech business.


The Data Analyst will help implement best-in-class corporate reporting tools, reporting into the Corporate Reporting Manager within the Data &
column2:
Analytics team.


Some of the responsibilities include


  • Support with the production of bespoke corporate reports in Tableau and MicroStrategy.
  • Analyse data for internal stakeholders and analyse &
column3:
support internal user requests for data and analytics to be deployed into the BI platform.
  • Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of the business strategy.


    • To apply, you should have


    • Worked as a Data Analyst or BI Analyst with experience developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients.
    • The ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data.
    • Advanced knowledge of data visualisation tools - Tableau OR MicroStrategy are a bonus.
    • SQL knowledge (intermediate).
    • Advanced Excel.
    • Fluent English.

3973303119,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-consultant-milano-at-kpmg-italy-3973303119?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=MXnEuXIcMh%2FJXxIbyls1pA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data & Analytics Consultant | Milano,KPMG Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Analytics Junior Consultant
In KPMG big data have little secrets.
Lighthouse is a KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Bolstered by frontier technologies and a host of skills shared across the globe, the members of KPMG Advisory's Data & analytics team are tasked with enhancing human decisions through analytics and machine learning technologies.

We have received prestigious international accolades for our ability to interpret and manage data. As a member of the Data Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to define and implement the best solutions on the market, with access to the wealth of knowledge shared among our centres of excellence around the world. By combining your expertise and technical experience in computer science, mathematics and statistics with your business knowledge and experience, you will be able to design and develop new predictive analytical solutions, often by integrating and correlating multiple factors presenting and sharing them professionally and competently.

In this business-oriented, technologically innovative environment, your work will range from data science to data engineering, with a healthy dose of information design and data visualisation. You will learn to:
design KPIs and the most efficient calculation frameworks
analyse, design and implement reporting models and monitoring dashboards
analyse business processes and design analytical support models
implement analytical solutions, support the go-live and handle application maintenance.
an ability to combine business skills with IT expertise
a degree in business, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, engineering management or computer science
an interest in business intelligence/data & analytics
excellent knowledge of English, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
knowledge of at least one of the following databases: Oracle/SQLServer/PostgreSQL
knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

You are a problem solver and never lose sight of your goals. You have strong interpersonal skills and are a team player. Your motivation and enthusiasm inspire confidence and empower change. You enjoy taking on challenges and are comfortable in fast-changing situations where your leadership abilities make the difference.

In today‚Äôs increasingly complex and interconnected world, clients need to transform and adapt ever more rapidly. At KPMG Advisory, we focus on the main drivers of change: strategies, corporate finance, organisational processes and models, technological platforms, risk management and organisational change. Our work is uniquely challenging given its scope, complexity and importance. You will experience disruptive technologies and set the new standards that impact their security. You will have access to global opportunities and the possibility of gaining skills and expertise that will help you reach your goals.
Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Management Consulting ‚Äì Lighthouse

Milan

In this business-oriented, technologically innovative environment, your work will range from data science to data engineering, with a healthy dose of information design and data visualisation. You will learn to:

  • design databases for analytical purposes

Entra a far parte di CRIF, un‚Äôazienda globale specializzata nello sviluppo e nella gestione di sistemi di informazioni creditizie (SIC), di business information e di soluzioni per il credito.

La mission che guida tutti noi di CRIF √® creare valore, aiutando le aziende nel miglioramento delle performance e i consumatori nella gestione consapevole del proprio credito attraverso una gamma completa di soluzioni e competenze professionali.

Verifica e lavorazione dei dati finanziari

Avrai la responsabilit√† di analizzare e verificare la correttezza dei dati inseriti nel database

Sarai coinvolto nello sviluppo di mercato e di business dell‚Äôarea.
Laurea in economia, ingegneria, statistica o discipline affini
Conoscenza e competenza in ambito SQL

Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese
Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
Buona gestione dello stress e del tempo nel rispetto delle scadenze

3966561602,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intelligence-analyst-intern-milano-at-rsm-italy-3966561602?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=uIyU5RpT%2FkG6g%2FGTMeO2lg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Intelligence Analyst Intern - Milano,RSM Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","In the RSM Service line Forensic Investigations & Intelligence, we combine a deep knowledge of corporate intelligence and business investigations with an unconditional love for technology. We move intelligence techniques out of their traditional cloak and dagger ways and apply them to new areas of business, powered by innovation and exceptional people.
Our priority is the well-being of our resources: training, peer education, professional growth and personal development.
We come from the most diverse life and work experiences and provide an exceptional level of service.

We are looking for a person whose fundamental traits are curiosity, imagination and independent thinking. They should be skilled in understanding and breaking down complex issues, prioritizing tasks and connecting the dots with an investigative mindset. We value the personal traits and characteristics that make us different. This is the reason why we welcome people of all nationalities and from almost every discipline.
Due to the sensitivity of the information that RSM deals with, we train and trust our resources to handle confidential information, thinking and acting accordingly.

We are looking to add an intelligence analyst intern to work with the team. As such, you will be tasked with collecting information and coordinating resources, online and offline, regarding companies and individuals, in order to answer our clients‚Äô most diverse strategic questions.
This position will be based at our office in Milan, Italy.
Conduct media and database research using complex search criteria and following a strict methodology
Provide research into potential issues relating to financial crimes, compliance concerns, money laundering, and corruption
Identify and interview human sources to develop intelligence and supplement research
Critically evaluate information on sources, opposed interests and roles in a wide range of industries
Contribute to, improve and develop new tools and procedures to keep our investigative methodology current, relevant and cost-effective
Build and maintain awareness of the broader context and implications of the various types of risk affecting the business (e.g. financial, legal, reputational)
Distil conclusions and identify hidden or indirect connections from research findings
Create thorough reports presenting information in a clear and narrative way
Present findings to Clients during in-person and remote meetings.
EU passport / work permit in the EU
Excellent command of Italian & English, with some life experience outside of your country of birth
Strong research, writing and analytical skills, including ability to summarize information quickly and effectively from multiple sources into concise assessments
An interest in OSINT and some experience in online research
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office suite, specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of and ability to turn information into actionable intelligence
Ability to take ideas from concept to completion, meet deadlines, communicate, and follow up swiftly and thoroughly
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to connect the dots organizationally, network effortlessly, influence various roles and profiles to drive collaboration and program excellence
Ability to take direction, feedback, and guidance from management and provide frequent project updates to ensure alignment with team goals
Strong oral/written communication and data presentation skills, including communicating effectively with business and technical teams
Positive attitude and ability to collaborate with others and work as a team.
Command of a third language, German proficiency is a plus
Experience in the fields of corporate intelligence, investigations or due diligence with a recognized company or association
Proficiency in public record, OSINT, investigative, and financial research resources
Advanced command of Excel (vlookups, pivots, macros, etc.).

RSM Italy Corporate Finance S.r.l. is part of RSM International, one of the world‚Äôs largest organizations specialized in auditing and tax consulting, corporate and financial with around 64,000 professionals and a presence in 120 countries with over 820 offices.

In Italy we are young and constantly growing (86% of our resources are under 40 years old and 43% are women) where everyone is encouraged and supported to develop their skills through ad hoc training.
We firmly believe in our values, which guide our approach to customers and colleagues:
We look forward to meeting you!

RSM is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, national origin, age, disability, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis.

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
To apply please send a CV.

Intelligence, we combine a deep knowledge of corporate intelligence and business investigations with an unconditional love for technology. We move intelligence techniques out of their traditional cloak and dagger ways and apply them to new areas of business, powered by innovation and exceptional people.

Our priority is the well-being of our resources: training, peer education, professional growth and personal development.


Our resources

We come from the most diverse life and work experiences and provide an exceptional level of service.

We are looking for a person whose fundamental traits are curiosity, imagination and independent thinking. They should be skilled in understanding and breaking down complex issues, prioritizing tasks and connecting the dots with an investigative mindset. We value the personal traits and characteristics that make us different. This is the reason why we welcome people of all nationalities and from almost every discipline.

Due to the sensitivity of the information that RSM deals with, we train and trust our resources to handle confidential information, thinking and acting accordingly.


The position

This position will be based at our office in Milan, Italy.

Thales people architect solutions that are relied upon to deliver operational advantage at every decisive moment throughout the mission. Defence and armed forces customers rely on us to deliver the full range of defensive systems for land, sea, and air. From early warning, to threat neutralisation, our platforms cover all levels from very short-range systems, to extended protection across the entire battle-space including Airspace Mobility Solutions, Vehicles and Tactical Systems and Missile Defence, Optronics, and Radar.

Gorgonzola hosts Navigations Air Systems (NAS) domain. The activity of NAS domain: avionics, navigation and radar systems for civil air traffic and technologies supporting the activities of civilian and military pilots, ATC controllers and technicians of several airlines, air traffic control agencies and Air Force around the world. Italy is the Group‚Äôs Competence center for the design, production and delivery of Navigation Aids products and Competence Centre for the delivery of non-Radar Surveillance Products.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Operations team as we enhance and optimize our data architecture. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data infrastructure, with a focus on automating data updates and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of our SQL-based data lake. In addition, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to produce key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics, facilitating data-driven decision-making and
contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, excellent technical skills in Python and SQL, and a keen interest in the business aspect of our operations.
Design, build, and maintain our data architecture, ensuring the seamless flow and integration of data across various systems and platforms.
Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data updates, quality checks, and data transformations, optimizing efficiency and accuracy.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and translate them into actionable insights, KPIs, and business metrics.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, generating valuable insights to support business decision-making processes.
Contribute to the development and implementation of data-driven strategies, leveraging your understanding of both data analytics and business objectives.
Work closely with cross-functional teams such as IT, operations, and finance to ensure data governance, data integrity, and security.
Communicate data findings, insights, and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with new developments in data analysis, technology, and industry best practices, actively seeking opportunities for continuous learning and improvement.
Suggest new applications of AI and Machine Learning based on intimacy with data and operational processes
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, or a related
discipline. A master's degree is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in building and maintaining SQL-based data lakes and automating data processes using Python scripts.
Solid understanding of data architecture principles, data modeling, and data integration techniques.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis, extracting insights from complex datasets, and producing KPIs and business metrics.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to gather, assess, and interpret large volumes of data effectively.
Strong business acumen and the ability to connect data insights with organizational goals and strategy.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and statistical analysis tools is preferred.
Exceptional attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Proactivity, independence and creativity in solving problems
Strong analysis and critical thinking skills.
An ability to turn ideas and initiatives into projects
A flexible approach to work and an agile work style
Willing to learn and attention to details

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Location: Gorgonzola, Italy

Thales people architect solutions that are relied upon to deliver operational advantage at every decisive moment throughout the mission. Defence and armed forces customers rely on us to deliver the full range of defensive systems for land, sea, and air. From early warning, to threat neutralisation, our platforms cover all levels from very short-range systems, to extended protection across the entire battle-space including Airspace Mobility Solutions, Vehicles and Tactical Systems and Missile Defence, Optronics, and Radar.

Gorgonzola hosts Navigations Air Systems (NAS) domain. The activity of NAS domain: avionics, navigation and radar systems for civil air traffic and technologies supporting the activities of civilian and military pilots, ATC controllers and technicians of several airlines, air traffic control agencies and Air Force around the world. Italy is the Group‚Äôs Competence center for the design, production and delivery of Navigation Aids products and Competence Centre for the delivery of non-Radar Surveillance Products.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Operations team as we enhance and optimize our data architecture. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data infrastructure, with a focus on automating data updates and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of our SQL-based data lake. In addition, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to produce key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics, facilitating data-driven decision-making and

contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.

The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, excellent technical skills in Python and SQL, and a keen interest in the business aspect of our operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain our data architecture, ensuring the seamless flow and integration of data across various systems and platforms.
  • Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data updates, quality checks, and data transformations, optimizing efficiency and accuracy.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and translate them into actionable insights, KPIs, and business metrics.
  • Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, generating valuable insights to support business decision-making processes.
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of data-driven strategies, leveraging your understanding of both data analytics and business objectives.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams such as IT, operations, and finance to ensure data governance, data integrity, and security.
  • Communicate data findings, insights, and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Stay up-to-date with new developments in data analysis, technology, and industry best practices, actively seeking opportunities for continuous learning and improvement.
  • Suggest new applications of AI and Machine Learning based on intimacy with data and operational processes


Education &
column2:
Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, or a related


discipline. A master's degree is a plus.

  • Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in building and maintaining SQL-based data lakes and automating data processes using Python scripts.
  • Solid understanding of data architecture principles, data modeling, and data integration techniques.
  • Demonstrated experience in data analysis, extracting insights from complex datasets, and producing KPIs and business metrics.
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to gather, assess, and interpret large volumes of data effectively.
  • Strong business acumen and the ability to connect data insights with organizational goals and strategy.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and statistical analysis tools is preferred.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Soft Skills

  • Proactivity, independence and creativity in solving problems
  • Strong analysis and critical thinking skills.
  • An ability to turn ideas and initiatives into projects
  • A flexible approach to work and an agile work style
  • Target oriented
  • Willing to learn and attention to details

3973970762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/supply-data-analyst-internship-at-ogury-3973970762?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=mBVSeKU0M40YevN0Ag8u1Q%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Supply Data Analyst - Internship,Ogury,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.
Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we‚Äôre changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.

Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.

Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we‚Äôre changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do

  • Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
  • Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
  • Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
  • Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.

About You

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Excel

3959654927,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/hr-data-analyst-at-kpmg-italy-3959654927?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=EX40jmUT%2BMoJ6UCR%2BmYPhw%3D%3D&trackingId=ydyNOqlrn3WxcuH%2FgyNMYg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,HR Data Analyst,KPMG Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We believe in the highest standards. After all, the first step in ensuring high-quality services for our clients is to operate internally at the highest levels. KPMG Support professionals have the fundamental task of supporting the daily activities of colleagues in the Business, with dedication and proactivity.
For the strengthening of our People structure in Milan, we are looking for an HR Data Analyst professional who will be responsible for the following activities:
Create, develop, and update reporting systems for the Management
Support the maintenance of data and oversee the accuracy of information in company systems
Conduct analyses on the data available in the HR information system
Contribute to the creation of interactive dashboards focused on personnel analysis to drive the overall human resources strategy
Support HR processes with data and statistics.
To be the ideal candidate, you should possess:
2-4 years of previous experience in the role
Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite
Good knowledge of the English language
Passion and enthusiasm for HR issues, curiosity, and proactivity, flexible approach, and respect for deadlines.
Are you a problem solver who never loses sight of your goals? Can you build strong relationships and promote collaboration? You might be the person we are looking for!
KPMG is one of the leading networks of professional services, a leader in audit and accounting, management consulting, and tax, legal, and administrative services.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for people, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity. These are the values of KPMG that guide the behaviors of the people who work there, representing its identity and way of being, creating an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge that allows our professionals to express their full potential.
Our role is a prominent one in a context of continuous and rapid change, requiring a set of new skills and abilities to support growth ambitions and the trust the market places in us.
Driven by passion, we strive every day to promote inclusion and growth, fostering an environment where everyone feels they belong.

The requested data will be processed in absolute compliance with the provisions of European Regulation 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"" or ""Privacy Regulation"") and its subsequent amendments and integrations. For more information, please refer to KPMG's Privacy Policy.
KPMG Business Services ensures equal opportunities.

3966561602,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intelligence-analyst-intern-milano-at-rsm-italy-3966561602?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=cy9ibEWA%2F5%2F7KIKuT3%2F8Gg%3D%3D&trackingId=w0ugDFmx9Sjy%2F8HTzY9zYQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Intelligence Analyst Intern - Milano,RSM Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","In the RSM Service line Forensic Investigations & Intelligence, we combine a deep knowledge of corporate intelligence and business investigations with an unconditional love for technology. We move intelligence techniques out of their traditional cloak and dagger ways and apply them to new areas of business, powered by innovation and exceptional people.
Our priority is the well-being of our resources: training, peer education, professional growth and personal development.
We come from the most diverse life and work experiences and provide an exceptional level of service.

We are looking for a person whose fundamental traits are curiosity, imagination and independent thinking. They should be skilled in understanding and breaking down complex issues, prioritizing tasks and connecting the dots with an investigative mindset. We value the personal traits and characteristics that make us different. This is the reason why we welcome people of all nationalities and from almost every discipline.
Due to the sensitivity of the information that RSM deals with, we train and trust our resources to handle confidential information, thinking and acting accordingly.

We are looking to add an intelligence analyst intern to work with the team. As such, you will be tasked with collecting information and coordinating resources, online and offline, regarding companies and individuals, in order to answer our clients‚Äô most diverse strategic questions.
This position will be based at our office in Milan, Italy.
Conduct media and database research using complex search criteria and following a strict methodology
Provide research into potential issues relating to financial crimes, compliance concerns, money laundering, and corruption
Identify and interview human sources to develop intelligence and supplement research
Critically evaluate information on sources, opposed interests and roles in a wide range of industries
Contribute to, improve and develop new tools and procedures to keep our investigative methodology current, relevant and cost-effective
Build and maintain awareness of the broader context and implications of the various types of risk affecting the business (e.g. financial, legal, reputational)
Distil conclusions and identify hidden or indirect connections from research findings
Create thorough reports presenting information in a clear and narrative way
Present findings to Clients during in-person and remote meetings.
EU passport / work permit in the EU
Excellent command of Italian & English, with some life experience outside of your country of birth
Strong research, writing and analytical skills, including ability to summarize information quickly and effectively from multiple sources into concise assessments
An interest in OSINT and some experience in online research
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office suite, specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of and ability to turn information into actionable intelligence
Ability to take ideas from concept to completion, meet deadlines, communicate, and follow up swiftly and thoroughly
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to connect the dots organizationally, network effortlessly, influence various roles and profiles to drive collaboration and program excellence
Ability to take direction, feedback, and guidance from management and provide frequent project updates to ensure alignment with team goals
Strong oral/written communication and data presentation skills, including communicating effectively with business and technical teams
Positive attitude and ability to collaborate with others and work as a team.
Command of a third language, German proficiency is a plus
Experience in the fields of corporate intelligence, investigations or due diligence with a recognized company or association
Proficiency in public record, OSINT, investigative, and financial research resources
Advanced command of Excel (vlookups, pivots, macros, etc.).

RSM Italy Corporate Finance S.r.l. is part of RSM International, one of the world‚Äôs largest organizations specialized in auditing and tax consulting, corporate and financial with around 64,000 professionals and a presence in 120 countries with over 820 offices.

In Italy we are young and constantly growing (86% of our resources are under 40 years old and 43% are women) where everyone is encouraged and supported to develop their skills through ad hoc training.
We firmly believe in our values, which guide our approach to customers and colleagues:
We look forward to meeting you!

RSM is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, national origin, age, disability, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis.

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
To apply please send a CV.

column25: • Proficiency in public record, OSINT, investigative, and financial research resources
column27:
• Advanced command of Excel (vlookups, pivots, macros, etc.).


    • GROWING UP IN RSM

    RSM Italy Corporate Finance S.r.l. is part of RSM International, one of the world‚Äôs largest organizations specialized in auditing and tax consulting, corporate and financial with around 64,000 professionals and a presence in 120 countries with over 820 offices.

    In Italy we are young and constantly growing (86% of our resources are under 40 years old and 43% are women) where everyone is encouraged and supported to develop their skills through ad hoc training.

    We firmly believe in our values, which guide our approach to customers and colleagues:

    • Diversity and inclusion
    • Innovation
    • Excellence
    • Integrity
    • Teamwork
    • Respect


    We look forward to meeting you!


    Notes

    RSM is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, national origin, age, disability, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis.

    Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

    To apply please send a CV.

We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:

Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement & innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.
WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
*Canteen.
*Flexible working hours.
*On-site health clinic.
*Remote Working.
*Employee benefits.

DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement &
column2:
innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
*Master's Degree.
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Good knowledge of English and Italian.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Data-driven mindset and approach.
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli
