3980212041,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-hicareer-3980212041?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=dzhs09yt2wWa8TzhIoAuwg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,HiCareer,European Union,"HiCareer is looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our client's remote-first tech scale-up. Our client, an online marketplace, is disrupting the retail industry with a strong focus on sustainability. The company is headquartered in Denmark, but its employees are based all around Europe.

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a company that is revolutionizing the retail industry with a sustainable approach. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting complex data to drive strategic decisions and optimize business performance. You will work in a collaborative environment with team members across Europe, contributing to the company's growth by providing valuable insights and recommendations.
As a Senior Data Analyst, your typical workday will include:

Data analysis and reporting: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Data modeling: Create and maintain data models to support various business functions. Ensure data accuracy and consistency across different sources.

Collaborative projects: Work closely with product managers, marketing teams, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights. Your analyses will support product development, marketing strategies, and overall business growth.

Business intelligence: Utilize BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau to visualize data and present findings to stakeholders. Your ability to convey complex data in an understandable manner will be crucial.
Data quality assurance: Implement data validation and cleansing processes to ensure the integrity and reliability of data. Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies.
Optimization: Identify opportunities to improve business processes and performance through data-driven insights. Recommend and implement changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Omni-channel growth: Consider the impact of B2B sales as part of your analysis and contribute to an omni-channel approach to drive growth and revenue across different sales channels.
We are looking for a candidate who not only has the technical skills but also fits well within the company's culture and values.
Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights. Experience in a startup or scale-up environment is a plus.
Technical skills: Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau. Experience with Python or R for data analysis is beneficial.
Business acumen: Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate data insights into strategic recommendations.
BI tools: Familiarity with BI tools and platforms. Experience in creating interactive dashboards and reports.
Data modeling: Expertise in data modeling and database design. Ability to work with large, complex datasets.
Problem-solving: Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills. Ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Remote work: Comfortable working in a remote-first environment with team members across Europe. Self-motivation and time management skills are essential.
Joining our client means becoming part of a forward-thinking company that values sustainability and innovation. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:
Innovative environment: Be part of a company disrupting the retail industry with a focus on sustainability. Your work will contribute to creating a positive environmental impact.
Remote-first culture: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely from anywhere in Europe. Our client values work-life balance and provides the tools and support needed to succeed in a remote setup.

Growth opportunities: There are ample opportunities for personal and professional growth in a dynamic and supportive environment. You will have the chance to take on new challenges and expand your skill set.
Collaborative team: Work with a diverse and talented team committed to innovation and excellence. Collaboration and teamwork are at the core of the company‚Äôs values.
If you are passionate about data analysis and want to be part of a forward-thinking, sustainability-focused company, we would love to hear from you.

Our client is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. They encourage applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, gender, age, disability, or any other protected status.

HiCareer is looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our client's remote-first tech scale-up. Our client, an online marketplace, is disrupting the retail industry with a strong focus on sustainability. The company is headquartered in Denmark, but its employees are based all around Europe.


About the job


This is a unique opportunity to be part of a company that is revolutionizing the retail industry with a sustainable approach. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting complex data to drive strategic decisions and optimize business performance. You will work in a collaborative environment with team members across Europe, contributing to the company's growth by providing valuable insights and recommendations.


Responsibilities


As a Senior Data Analyst, your typical workday will include:


  • Data analysis and reporting: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Data modeling: Create and maintain data models to support various business functions. Ensure data accuracy and consistency across different sources.
  • Collaborative projects: Work closely with product managers, marketing teams, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights. Your analyses will support product development, marketing strategies, and overall business growth.
  • Business intelligence: Utilize BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau to visualize data and present findings to stakeholders. Your ability to convey complex data in an understandable manner will be crucial.
  • Data quality assurance: Implement data validation and cleansing processes to ensure the integrity and reliability of data. Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies.
  • Optimization: Identify opportunities to improve business processes and performance through data-driven insights. Recommend and implement changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Omni-channel growth: Consider the impact of B2B sales as part of your analysis and contribute to an omni-channel approach to drive growth and revenue across different sales channels.



Your profile


We are looking for a candidate who not only has the technical skills but also fits well within the company's culture and values.


  • Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights. Experience in a startup or scale-up environment is a plus.
  • Technical skills: Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau. Experience with Python or R for data analysis is beneficial.
  • Business acumen: Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate data insights into strategic recommendations.
  • BI tools: Familiarity with BI tools and platforms. Experience in creating interactive dashboards and reports.
  • Data modeling: Expertise in data modeling and database design. Ability to work with large, complex datasets.
  • Problem-solving: Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills. Ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
  • Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Remote work: Comfortable working in a remote-first environment with team members across Europe. Self-motivation and time management skills are essential.



Why join?


Joining our client means becoming part of a forward-thinking company that values sustainability and innovation. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:


  • Innovative environment: Be part of a company disrupting the retail industry with a focus on sustainability. Your work will contribute to creating a positive environmental impact.
  • Remote-first culture: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely from anywhere in Europe. Our client values work-life balance and provides the tools and support needed to succeed in a remote setup.
  • Growth opportunities: There are ample opportunities for personal and professional growth in a dynamic and supportive environment. You will have the chance to take on new challenges and expand your skill set.
  • Collaborative team: Work with a diverse and talented team committed to innovation and excellence. Collaboration and teamwork are at the core of the company‚Äôs values.



If you are passionate about data analysis and want to be part of a forward-thinking, sustainability-focused company, we would love to hear from you.


-------


Our client is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. They encourage applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, gender, age, disability, or any other protected status.

De afdeling Data and Analytics is het kloppend hart van Colruyt Group in het omgaan met informatie. Als Data Analist ontwikkel je BI-producten, analyseer je data en maak je deze inzichtelijk voor je eindgebruikers. Een leerrijke job met ruimte voor initiatief en verrijkende samenwerkingen!
Als Data Analist ga je in overleg met onze interne partners en directies om hun noden te verzamelen voor het bouwen van rapporten, cockpits en dashboards.

Je bent ook bij het verdere gehele proces betrokken. Dat betekent van het analyseren van datanoden tot het presenteren van de rapporten. Hierin werk je nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders zoals analisten, developers, projectmanagers en eindgebruikers.
Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en onderhoudt de semantische laag, de SAP BO Universe, die afgestemd is op het onderliggende datamodel.
Je stelt testscenario‚Äôs op en levert de nodige steun voor de validering van de producten.
Je documenteert de producten en leidt de eindgebruikers op zodat ze zich ermee vertrouwd voelen.
Je neemt deel aan de Business Intelligence-ombudswerking waarin je op basis van incidenten technische/functionele problemen analyseert en corrigerende acties uitvoert.
Je werkt op ons hoofdkantoor te Halle en kan tot 3 dagen per week van thuis uit werken.

Kennis en ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in bv. informatiemanagement of een andere data-gedreven studie, of hebt gelijkwaardige ervaring. Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Power BI en/of Tableau en SQL is een must.

Communicatief ‚Äì Je bent communicatief ingesteld, bent een echte teamspeler, en legt vlot contact. Je capteert vlot noden bij je eindgebruikers en overlegt regelmatig. Je zoekt actief naar de beste oplossing.

Analytisch en conceptueel ‚Äì Je haalt vlot de te behandelen delen uit een complex gegeven en kan oorzaak en gevolg onderscheiden. Daarnaast heb je snel inzicht in complexe kwesties en plaats je de zaken in een breder perspectief.

Kwaliteit ‚Äì Je hebt een end-to-end mentaliteit en gaat steeds voor de hoogste kwaliteit in wat je oplevert. Je denkt vanuit oplossingen en bewaakt de balans tussen de wensen van je eindgebruikers en optimalisaties die tijdens het proces kunnen opduiken.
Talen ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels, zodat je met al je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders goed kan samenwerken.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.

Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je werkt in een klein en divers team met collega‚Äôs die over verschillende vaardigheden beschikken.

Werken bij Colruyt Group, dat is elke dag onze missie waarmaken: samen duurzaam meerwaarde cre√´ren. Wij zorgen voor ondersteuning en kansen, jij kan initiatief nemen en idee√´n voorstellen. Wij ondersteunen je groei, want als jij groeit, dan doen wij dat ook.

Functie:

Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

  • Als Data Analist ga je in overleg met onze interne partners en directies om hun noden te verzamelen voor het bouwen van rapporten, cockpits en dashboards.
  • Je bent ook bij het verdere gehele proces betrokken. Dat betekent van het analyseren van datanoden tot het presenteren van de rapporten. Hierin werk je nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders zoals analisten, developers, projectmanagers en eindgebruikers.

  • Je documenteert de producten en leidt de eindgebruikers op zodat ze zich ermee vertrouwd voelen.
  • Je neemt deel aan de Business Intelligence-ombudswerking waarin je op basis van incidenten technische/functionele problemen analyseert en corrigerende acties uitvoert.

Je werkt op ons hoofdkantoor te Halle en kan tot 3 dagen per week van thuis uit werken.

  • Kennis en ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in bv. informatiemanagement of een andere data-gedreven studie, of hebt gelijkwaardige ervaring. Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Power BI en/of Tableau en SQL is een must.
  • Communicatief ‚Äì Je bent communicatief ingesteld, bent een echte teamspeler, en legt vlot contact. Je capteert vlot noden bij je eindgebruikers en overlegt regelmatig. Je zoekt actief naar de beste oplossing.
  • Analytisch en conceptueel ‚Äì Je haalt vlot de te behandelen delen uit een complex gegeven en kan oorzaak en gevolg onderscheiden. Daarnaast heb je snel inzicht in complexe kwesties en plaats je de zaken in een breder perspectief.
  • Kwaliteit ‚Äì Je hebt een end-to-end mentaliteit en gaat steeds voor de hoogste kwaliteit in wat je oplevert. Je denkt vanuit oplossingen en bewaakt de balans tussen de wensen van je eindgebruikers en optimalisaties die tijdens het proces kunnen opduiken.
  • Talen ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels, zodat je met al je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders goed kan samenwerken.


Wij bieden:

  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
  • Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
  • Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
  • Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je werkt in een klein en divers team met collega‚Äôs die over verschillende vaardigheden beschikken.

Werken bij Colruyt Group, dat is elke dag onze missie waarmaken: samen duurzaam meerwaarde cre√´ren. Wij zorgen voor ondersteuning en kansen, jij kan initiatief nemen en idee√´n voorstellen. Wij ondersteunen je groei, want als jij groeit, dan doen wij dat ook.

3976668141,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-catcoon-3976668141?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=3UmE8b7AC0h%2FDNFqwVUfWQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Catcoon,Antwerp Metropolitan Area,"De voorbije 2 jaar hebben we met Catcoon een indrukwekkende groei doorgemaakt en scherpte we onze dienstverlening aan, met een speciale focus op sectoren waar we √©cht het verschil maken: HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector en Energie.

Onze ambitie is om te blijven groeien en daarom zoeken we een gedreven Data Analyst om samen met onze klanten datagestuurde besluitvorming te stimuleren en hen te helpen transformeren richting een data gedreven organisatie. Je werkt samen met verschillende rollen in het datadomein en het is aan jou om ervoor te zorgen dat data wordt omgezet in verstaanbare inzichten die de bedrijfsstrategie ondersteunen.

Heb je zin om een dosis empathie en rationeel gezond verstand te combineren met data gedreven inzichten en processen? Ben jij iemand die analytische vaardigheden combineert met zakelijk inzicht, de kracht van data begrijpt en kan zorgen voor de juiste governance?
Dan leren we je graag kennen.
Je wordt ingezet als Data & Analytics consultant voor √©√©n van onze klanten binnen onze sector (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je analyseert complexe datasets om bruikbare inzichten te genereren die de strategische doelen van de klant ondersteunen.
Je helpt bij het opzetten van een Data & Analytics groeipad van reactieve analyses naar voorspellende analyses.
Je gebruikt geavanceerde analytische technieken en tools om patronen te identificeren, voorspellingen te doen en aanbevelingen te geven.
Je werkt nauw samen met klantteams om data-analyse initiatieven te leiden en de implementatie van data gestuurde besluitvormingsprocessen te ondersteunen.
Je presenteert en visualiseert gegevens op een manier die begrijpelijk en overtuigend is voor zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je verzamelt, reinigt en organiseert data uit verschillende bronnen om inzichten te cre√´ren voor de klanten.
Je implementeert het data governance beleid en procedures om datakwaliteit, data-integriteit en data-veiligheid te waarborgen bij de klant. Je kan hier ook kritisch naar kijken en advies over geven.
Je blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen in data science, machine learning, big data technologie√´n en data governance.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Data-analyse of Business Intelligence
Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 1 jaar ervaring in 1 van onze sectoren (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je bent gepassioneerd door data en hebt diepgaande kennis van analytische methoden, statistische modellen en data governance principes.
Je hebt ervaring met SQL, Python, R of andere data-analyse tools en platforms.
Je hebt ervaring met het visualiseren van data met tools als Tableau, Power BI, Qklik of vergelijkbare software.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt complexe idee√´n duidelijk en effectief communiceren aan een gevarieerd publiek.
Je bent kritisch en weet wanneer te luisteren, wanneer terug te duwen en wanneer te leiden.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, innovatief en hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen.
Wat mag je van ons verwachten?
Een competitief loon in functie van jouw ervaring
Alles wat je nodig hebt om jouw job uit te oefenen, zowel thuis als op kantoor
Vrijheid en ruimte voor eigen idee√´n en initiatief
De optie om aan persoonlijke cases te werken met een focus op onderzoek en innovatie
Interne opleidingen en de mogelijkheid om te groeien in een ervaren team
Sfeervol hoofdkantoor in een oude opslagplaats nabij Park Spoor Noord te Antwerpen (www.hoi.be)
Extralegale voordelen zoals hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques

3984249340,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-3984249340?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=lITGIya3PL1K0U5dCDyqcQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.
We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Vans, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Client-facing for the presentation of intelligence work.
2 to 6 years of experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy (seniority level to be determined based on your background and experience).
Strong research and analytical skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
Dashboarding, data collection and data visualisation experience
Knowledge of customer research is a plus
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.

column2: balanced mix of remote work and in-office presence options

column1: Latest collaborative tech and tools to thrive,
As an Ogilvy Social. Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training, and career conversations, while doing strong work, that works on a daily basis.

About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Vans, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Your Main Responsibilities

  • Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
  • Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
  • Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
  • Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
  • Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
  • Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
  • Client-facing for the presentation of intelligence work.

Your Track Record Shows

  • 2 to 6 years of experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy (seniority level to be determined based on your background and experience).
  • Strong research and analytical skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
  • Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
  • Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
  • Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
  • Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.

Must-have

  • Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
  • Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
  • A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
  • A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
  • Strong reporting and visualisation skills

Nice-to-have

  • Dashboarding, data collection and data visualisation experience
  • Sprinklr expertise
  • Knowledge of customer research is a plus

OFFER

  • Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
  • Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
  • We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
  • We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
  • Enjoy attractive employment benefits including:
    • Flexible working policy
column2:
balanced mix of remote work and in-office presence options
  • Meal &

column4: integration activities, Lunch&amp

Learns...

3945419806,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/performance-data-analyst-f-m-at-candriam-3945419806?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=Pyweex0IyG3qO4pi1igWzg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Performance & Data Analyst F/M,Candriam,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Position description
Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.
This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.
It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.
You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.
You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges

column2: Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus

Develop the steering KPI‚Äôs and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI‚Äôs and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance

Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‚Äòad hoc‚Äô analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.

Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders & experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.

Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.‚Äôs needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.‚Äôs essential KPI‚Äôs.
3 years of experience in a similar position
Data analysis and data management expertise
Mastery of IT tools linked to data extraction, data manipulation and data analysis
Interest in numbers (reports and KPIs), proactivity, excellent communication skills
Fluent French and a good level of English

A dynamic working environment where you have every opportunity for personal development. Moreover, you can look forward to the following compensation and benefits package: a market competitive salary, a company car, performance bonus, meal vouchers, 32 holidays per year, pension provision, life assurance and accident cover, and medical insurance.
Inspired? Then we would like to hear from you! If there‚Äôs a match in the making, we‚Äôll invite you for a first interview.

In this role, you will be in charge of the creation and maintenance of KPI‚Äôs, reporting and dashboards, facilitating the steering of the Infrastructure activities, as well as of detailed data analysis and the presentation of the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions.


Your responsibilities:

  • Identify and inventorize the data sources for the Infrastructure department, validate the data consistency and identity the necessary and potential improvements
  • Identify and define the KPI‚Äôs to be measured based on the requests and needs of the Teams within the Infrastructure department, the operational processes and own expertise within the domain.
  • Develop the steering KPI‚Äôs and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI‚Äôs and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance
  • Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‚Äòad hoc‚Äô analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.
  • Synthesize and present the dashboards and the results of specific analyses together with the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions in a clear manner adapted to the audience.
  • Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders &
column2:
experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.
  • Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.‚Äôs needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.‚Äôs essential KPI‚Äôs.

3974746406,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-dynafin-consulting-3974746406?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=XHWU%2B3HBrmYTolokpmCbmA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,DynaFin Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Roles & Responsibilities

In order to expand our team, DynaFin, is currently seeking a junior Data Analyst to be the bridge between business stakeholders and data engineers. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring data-driven decision-making and optimizing data processes within the organization.

At DynaFin, you will thrive in an environment that values innovation and continuous growth. You will take part in a wide range of projects at different financial institutions, gaining invaluable experience and developing professionally.
Interview stakeholders to gather business requirements.
Analyze and translate key data and information.
Write a feasibility study: high-level architecture of how data will be delivered, what the requirements are, service level agreements, etc.
Model and define transformation rules to meet organizational needs and requirements.
Assist and participate in data validation and cleansing to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the chain.
Provide reports that enable the 'business' to make decisions.
‚Ä¢ You have a Master's degree in economics, finance, mathematics, law, or computer science,
‚Ä¢ You have between 3 and 5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...).
‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English and Dutch with a good knowledge of French
‚Ä¢ Soft Skills: motivated, excellent communicator, autonomous, analytical mind, time management skills, team spirit, proactive.
Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.

DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest ‚Äì Payments ‚Äì Credits ‚Äì Insurance ‚Äì Data - Risk & Compliance.
In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.

column2:
Responsibilities


In order to expand our team, DynaFin, is currently seeking a junior Data Analyst to be the bridge between business stakeholders and data engineers. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring data-driven decision-making and optimizing data processes within the organization.


Why DynaFin?


At DynaFin, you will thrive in an environment that values innovation and continuous growth. You will take part in a wide range of projects at different financial institutions, gaining invaluable experience and developing professionally.


Your Missions:



  • Interview stakeholders to gather business requirements.
  • Analyze and translate key data and information.
  • Write a feasibility study: high-level architecture of how data will be delivered, what the requirements are, service level agreements, etc.
  • Describe functional mapping to objectives.
  • Model and define transformation rules to meet organizational needs and requirements.
  • Assist and participate in data validation and cleansing to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the chain.
  • Provide reports that enable the 'business' to make decisions.



Profile


‚Ä¢ You have a Master's degree in economics, finance, mathematics, law, or computer science,

‚Ä¢ You have between 3 and 5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...).

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English and Dutch with a good knowledge of French

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Data Modeling

‚Ä¢ Experience with Agile methodologies.

‚Ä¢ Python/Pyspark, PowerBI/Tableau, Excel

‚Ä¢ Soft Skills: motivated, excellent communicator, autonomous, analytical mind, time management skills, team spirit, proactive.


Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.



About Dynafin Consulting

o Languages = English proficiency ‚Äì Fench/Dutch is a plus.


Work policy: hybrid, 2 days/week in the office, "" days/week remote.

3970987596,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelance-data-business-analyst-at-mynextcompany-3970987596?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=c3wyPat4AXgcG%2BqKoeeH4w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Freelance Data Business Analyst,MyNextCompany,European Union,"Freelance Data Business Analyst - centralising experiment data - full remote
Start date mid July till end of the year
3+ years as a Data Analyst or in a related role in an Agile setting
Experience with Chemistry & Lab softwares (eg. Electronic Lab Notebook, LIMS etc.)
Expert in SQL, Excel and/or Google sheets, macros VBA and/or Google Apps Script
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills
Strong organisational & time management skills, with a self-starting, entrepreneurial mindset
Excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills
Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques, process modelling, and documentation
Ability to translate non-technical information into a technical level of detail that developers can work with
Proficiency in using project management and collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence)

The Data Business Analyst will be part of the Connected Research & Build the Future Journey which encompasses several product groups dedicated to Research & Innovation, Group Sustainability and New Business Models (Research Digitisation, Data Acquisition‚Ä¶).
The Data Business Analyst will work on our internal R&I web applications for centralising experiment data and creating outputs to help with researcher analysis - reporting, BI, AI.
They will help create cohesive end-to-end solutions from the ingestion of data, ETL, and display/exploration in web apps and BI dashboards.
Work closely with the Product Owner and business analysts to understand stakeholder needs, objectives, and challenges
Support the business analysts by collecting and analysing data across the business to make informed decisions
Develop customised spreadsheets with quality assurance (i.e. user testing/integration testing) for business stakeholders
Standardise spreadsheets or any data source with a business analysis approach to reflect the best user value
Transform and prepare data from the diverse lab application sources to get it ready to be ingested into the cloud
Own spreadsheet development good practices including functional and non-functional documentation
Ensure that delivered solutions meet the specified requirements and are of high quality
Participate in system testing, user acceptance testing, and validation of implemented solutions
Elicit, document, and analyse business requirements, use cases, and workflows
Participate in daily standup scrums, sprint planning meetings, sprint reviews and retrospective
Actively follow the progress of the sprint to confirm implementation meets the intent of acceptance criteria
Please only reply if you have the MUST HAVE requirements, with your CV and expected daily rate. NO in-mails please! EU residents only. Thank you.

3978125816,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-all-genders-at-gostudent-3978125816?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=IRR9zhbwOz8agt9NCpsJwg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Marketing Data Analyst (all genders),GoStudent,European Union,"The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.
Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.

Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.
3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
Your way to unlock your full potential
Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job
column2: it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.

column1: Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.

Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.

Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.
Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!
Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote from Austria.

Hybrid: Vienna.

Your Role in Our Journey

  • Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
  • Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
  • Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data &
column2:
business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
  • Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
  • Drive adaptation of new tools &
column3:
technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.

Your impact

  • 3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
  • Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
  • Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
  • Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
  • Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
  • Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.

Your way to unlock your full potential

  • Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job
column4:
it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
  • Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
  • Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week &
column5:
5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
  • Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
  • Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
  • Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
  • Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.

    • Life at GoStudent:

    Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

    GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

    We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

    Openness Statement

    At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring &
column6:
to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about ""Who we are""

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy &
column7: Compliance Information

Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.
The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.
This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.
Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
What your day will look like
Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards
What we are looking for in you?
Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum
üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications

  • You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We Offer

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity.

If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging their proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.

Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.

You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.
Your profile as a Data Analyst :
You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).
A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.

Your mission :

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity.

If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.


Your responsabilities :

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging their proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily :

  • You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
  • You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
  • You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
  • Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
  • You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
  • You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
  • You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Your profile as a Data Analyst :

  • You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.
  • You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
  • You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
  • You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.
  • You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.
  • You are fluent in French and English (verbal &
column2:
written).


Our offer :

  • A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
  • An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
  • In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
  • An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
  • Up to 46 days of leave per year.

In je rol als PowerBI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega‚Äôs aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten.

Bovendien ben je een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.

Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.

Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!
Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?
We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam √©n leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions fun team.
Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carri√®repaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.

Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.
Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je √©cht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collega‚Äôs. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten bij aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen. Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. Binnen een cultuur gedreven door familiewaarden: vol vertrouwen, mensgericht, open, loyaal en respectvol. Met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een trots, succesvol, snelgroeiend, innovatief, Europees IT-bedrijf vol ambities.

En tant que Data Mining Analyst, vous fournissez, au management, des solutions bas√©es sur des donn√©es destin√©es √† faciliter la prise de d√©cision (via le machine learning et le data mining).

3980311927,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-power-bi-at-sd-worx-belgium-3980311927?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=kTuOCLRvFIVpWZWdfMmMqw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Analyst - Power BI,SD Worx Belgium,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","At SD Worx, we are focused on building capability and flexibility to meet the growth of the business whilst increasing the profitability across the organisation. We support SD Worx on most of the business areas such as HR, Finance, Marketing, Software Development, Testing, Implementation and Service Delivery. There are numerous opportunities at SD Worx for people with the right blend of skills, experience and character! Are you ready to join us?

The Corporate Data Intelligence team, part of the Corporate Information Office, is providing reports, dashboards & analytics for the entire SD Worx Group. The team takes care of the data warehouse architecture, the ETL-processes, data mappings & definitions, and the transformation of Corporate Data into Information & Insights. The ultimate goal is to reinforce Business Excellence in all domains and at all levels in the organization.
What does your day look like?
In this role, you specifically focus on first line support for data & insight needs of our Sales/Business.
You also analyze how we can improve our Corporate Data Solutions and to unlock new opportunities to increase our efficiency and/or impact on the organization.
Together with your colleagues, you set-up new or improve existing data solutions.
You present and promote solutions to the internal stakeholders
You contribute within & between teams, by sharing your knowledge and best practices.
Depending on personal interest, you also have to opportunity
- to work on other Information Office projects within other domains (eg. Finance, Sales, Operations, HR, Marketing‚Ä¶)
You have strong communication and you are able to act as a Partner for our internal Businesses.
You have a strong interest in data, reporting and analytics.
You have expertise in the reporting tool Power Bi (approximately 5 years).
You are a team player with flexibility to engage both in small individual assignments as in large team assignments.
You are eager to learn and have a result-driven mind-set
Knowledge of Reporting Tools such as Tableau, IBM Cognos.
From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.

SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

At SD Worx, we are focused on building capability and flexibility to meet the growth of the business whilst increasing the profitability across the organisation. We support SD Worx on most of the business areas such as HR, Finance, Marketing, Software Development, Testing, Implementation and Service Delivery. There are numerous opportunities at SD Worx for people with the right blend of skills, experience and character! Are you ready to join us?

3974297231,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-specialist-at-randstad-digital-belgium-3974297231?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=JK25rUkhlUfI0c6Tpc7BbQ%3D%3D&trackingId=E5FCjPdzKWZLBtrfn8W4rw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Specialist,Randstad Digital Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Aandacht, alle data enthousiasten, spreadsheet tovenaars en data visualisatie kampioenen! We zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde data-analist die ons team komt versterken en ons helpt de wereld van de cijfers te veroveren! Je staat in voor het omzetten van ruwe gegevens in verbluffende inzichten die ons helpen de juiste beslissingen te nemen. Met jouw oog voor detail en liefde voor alles wat met data te maken heeft, zul je verborgen patronen ontdekken en toekomstige trends voorspellen. Dus als je klaar bent om de wereld van analytics aan te pakken, dan willen we jou in ons team!

Als data-analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, organiseren, opschonen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote en complexe datasets uit verschillende bronnen om zinvolle inzichten en aanbevelingen te bieden.
Je bent de aangewezen persoon voor datagestuurde besluitvorming, waarbij je je expertise in statistische en analytische technieken gebruikt om trends, patronen en kansen te identificeren.
Maar daar blijft het niet bij! Je brengt je bevindingen tot leven door visuele rapporten en presentaties te maken die je collega's en klanten informeren en inspireren.
Om in deze functie te slagen, moet je:
Een innovatieve denker zijn die verschillende gegevensbronnen kan integreren om weloverwogen beslissingen te nemen
Jezelf kunnen ontwikkelen en op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste tools en technieken in het vakgebied
Samenwerken met verschillende stakeholders om ervoor te zorgen dat je inzichten worden begrepen en dat ernaar wordt gehandeld
Een stevige technische basis hebben in databases (SQL server, Excel, Oracle), rapportagetools (Tableau of Qlik Sense) en programmeertalen (Python, R).

Een gepersonaliseerd salarispakket: we weten dat iedereen andere behoeften heeft, dus heb je de kans om je salaris aan te vullen met voordelen die je vandaag het meest nodig hebt. Een auto, extra vakantiedagen, een leasefiets,... de keuze is aan jou dankzij ons Flex Income Plan!

Persoonlijke begeleiding: wij geloven in de kracht van menselijke contacten, dus wijzen we je een toegewijde talentmanager toe die altijd achter je staat. Of je nu steun nodig hebt bij uitdagende projecten of gewoon een luisterend oor, je talentmanager is er voor je.

Carri√®replanning en professionele ontwikkeling: ons leer- en ontwikkelingsteam is er om je te helpen je droomcarri√®re te cre√´ren. Beschouw hen als je fee√´npeetouders - maar dan met minder bibbidi-bobbidi-boo.

Team evenementen: wij gaan uit van een ‚Äòwork hard, play hard‚Äô mentaliteit. Van een after work drink tot een quizavond, wij zorgen ervoor dat je je een deel van de familie voelt (zelfs als je de rare neef bent die veel van Java weet).

We care, we grow, we recognize: we investeren in deze 3 pijlers om een duurzame carri√®re voor jou op te bouwen. We hebben tal van initiatieven om je te helpen gezond en gelukkig te blijven, zodat je elke uitdaging die op je pad komt kunt aangaan en je je ook gewaardeerd voelt.
Uitdagende projecten en een ondernemende cultuur: maak je klaar om je spieren te laten werken aan enkele indrukwekkende projecten. Het is net de Olympische Spelen, maar dan zonder lycra.

Leren van vakgenoten: als technisch expert maak je deel uit van onze chapters: levendige gemeenschappen vol collega's die gepassioneerd zijn over een bepaald vakgebied. In onze chapters gaat het erom het leren binnen uw vakgebied te bevorderen - op een leuke en informele manier!

    Leren van vakgenoten: als technisch expert maak je deel uit van onze chapters: levendige gemeenschappen vol collega's die gepassioneerd zijn over een bepaald vakgebied. In onze chapters gaat het erom het leren binnen uw vakgebied te bevorderen - op een leuke en informele manier!
