3965321438,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-acensi-3965321438?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=JK25rUkhlUfI0c6Tpc7BbQ%3D%3D&trackingId=IxZSVwAmRuzqra1%2F4CZHeA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Engineer,ACENSI,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","ACENSI BELGIUM is looking for his Client a Data Engineer (F/M/X).

Within the context of executing the operational plan for 2024-2026, the COO Office has been tasked with leading the implementation of standardized automated reporting to continuously evaluate automation levels across our Clients' various Lines of Business (LoBs).
This reporting, referred to as the ""automation framework,"" aims to monitor performance indicators to identify deviations from our annual goals and specific scopes.
The goal is to identify root causes of deviations and assess the need for action plans and remediations with the business.
The implementation of this dashboard involves collaboration among business resources (BI teams within the LoBs), IT & Data resources, and members of the COO Office team.
As a support function within the BI Transformation team, you will assist Business Units (BUs) in transforming their data value chains to easily present automation KPIs.
You will support BI decentralized teams in both Life and P&C Corp to deliver robust solutions for data preparation and team modeling before centralized reporting.
Mastery of BI tools and data value chain elements to effectively prepare and structure data using tabular models for self-service reporting.
Technical expertise in data extraction, manipulation, and presentation (SQL, Azure Analysis Services/Visual Studio, PowerBI, Excel, and other tools).
Knowledge of data modeling standards (dimensional modeling, snowflake vs. star schemas, data warehouses, data marts).
Ensure best practices in data exploitation, efficient model construction, and the use of reporting tools within project scope.
Regular communication with business sponsors and all project stakeholders, providing consistent feedback to project sponsors.

Our client is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to design, develop, and maintain their data infrastructure, ensuring data accessibility, reliability, and readiness for analysis. Your work will empower data-driven decisions across the company.
Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines.
Database Management: Optimize and manage relational and non-relational databases.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources including APIs and internal systems.
Data Quality: Implement validation and cleansing processes to ensure data integrity.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models for reporting and analytics.
Collaboration: Work with data scientists and analysts to meet data needs.
Performance Optimization: Ensure efficient data retrieval and processing.
Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor pipeline performance and troubleshoot issues.
Documentation: Maintain documentation for pipelines, architecture, and processes.
Security and Compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or related field. Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.
Experience with ETL tools and big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, Scala).
Familiarity with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake).
Experience with data pipeline tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Luigi).
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy.

Job Summary:

Our client is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to design, develop, and maintain their data infrastructure, ensuring data accessibility, reliability, and readiness for analysis. Your work will empower data-driven decisions across the company.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines.
  • Database Management: Optimize and manage relational and non-relational databases.
  • Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources including APIs and internal systems.
  • Data Quality: Implement validation and cleansing processes to ensure data integrity.
  • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models for reporting and analytics.
  • Collaboration: Work with data scientists and analysts to meet data needs.
  • Performance Optimization: Ensure efficient data retrieval and processing.
  • Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor pipeline performance and troubleshoot issues.
  • Documentation: Maintain documentation for pipelines, architecture, and processes.
  • Security and Compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations.


Qualifications:


Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or related field. Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.


Experience:

  • 3+ years in data engineering.
  • Experience with ETL tools and big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).


Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, Scala).
  • Familiarity with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake).
  • Experience with data pipeline tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Luigi).


Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy.

3976907378,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-senior-consultant-at-pwc-belgium-3976907378?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=b4ImMsukSu9i70S4Aj8X6g%3D%3D&trackingId=yOoMzU8m%2BXoCJPsiJTKEfg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analytics (Senior) Consultant,PwC Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Description & Summary
Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact.¬† Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you‚Äôre at the right place.¬†
Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a network of multiple possibilities - where you want to make an impact is always up to you. Under the expert stewardship of our Advisory experts, you‚Äôll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you‚Äôll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that‚Äôs making a difference.

A career within Managed Services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients face their big complex and operational problems. We focus on understanding the forces shaping their business and developing industry tailored solutions that support our clients through the entire lifecycle. As a (senior) associate within the IT Support Team, you'll get the opportunity to help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution and beyond.¬†
Are you looking for a challenging job in a dynamic and innovative environment? You are about to find the perfect match!

Are you a data and IT enthusiast who also talks the language of business? Do you have a passion for solving complex data-based problems, creating, and developing reports, dashboards and troubleshooting data errors and issues?¬†
What you will do and learn:
You help our clients in the support and execution of their data and analytics of it.
Act as point of contact to collect, clean, transform and analyze data for efficient decision making to meet business expectation
Participate in the data analytics tool selection process (RfX, etc.)¬†
Report and modelize key insights from performed analysis to be shared with key stakeholders (e.g: via PowerBI, Tableau, Slides, etc.)
Working closely with different teams to ensure issues and requests are addressed timely
Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise
Follow risk management and compliance procedures
Share and collaborate effectively with others
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner ‚Äì verbally and in the materials I produce
Build and maintain an internal and external network
Use creative problem-solving methods and work in an international, multidisciplinary team
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct
Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms

A relevant university degree in IT (management) or IT technology-related programmes or Business Administration/Management, Economics, Computer and Information Science, or any other relevant university degree that showcases your capabilities¬†
You have a strong interest in data analytics, IT tools and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You have a strong ability to leverage and turn your key findings into clear and outstanding presentations
0 to 5 years of experience in data analytics
Extensive experience developing and deploying reports, dashboards, and metrics
The ability to express yourself fluently in English and Dutch and/or French¬†
Excellent time management skills under tight deadlines
The ability to work independently and as part of a team
Keep upskilling yourself via training and on the job learning
Moreover, you have an interest, experience and/or technical expertise in several of the following:
Knowledge of PowerApps and Power Automate is a plus
SQL / Python knowledge is a plus
Project management & Microsoft certification is a plus (e.g. Prince II, PMI, Agile/Scrum, Azure AI, Power BI Data Analyst Associate, etc.)
Interest in new technologies like generative AI
Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan giving you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle

Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement)

Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes
Customer Service, Data Analysis, People Management, Project Management, Stakeholder Management

Taal: Nederlands of Engels (geen workpermit toegestaan)

Bedrijfsomschrijving: Onze klant is een toonaangevende speler in de internationale markt, met een stevig verankerd data concept en een brede waaier aan mogelijkheden. Ter uitbreiding van hun team zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data Engineer die zowel technisch sterk is als strategisch inzicht heeft en uitstekend kan communiceren met diverse stakeholders.

Functieomschrijving: Als Senior Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van geavanceerde data-oplossingen binnen het Azure-ecosysteem. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams en stakeholders om ervoor te zorgen dat de data-oplossingen voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -strategie√´n. Je bent een spilfiguur in het data engineering team en draagt bij aan de verdere ontwikkeling en optimalisatie van data pipelines, data warehouses en ETL-processen.
Ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van data pipelines en ETL-processen in Azure.
Optimaliseren van data opslag en -verwerking met behulp van Databricks en SQL.
Schrijven van effici√´nte en schaalbare Python-code.
Communiceren en afstemmen met stakeholders om hun behoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar technische oplossingen.
Bijdragen aan de strategische data roadmap van het bedrijf.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in data engineering binnen het Azure-ecosysteem.
Sterke kennis van en ervaring met de volgende tools en technologie√´n:
Minimaal een bachelor diploma in Computerwetenschappen of een vergelijkbare opleiding.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en ervaring in stakeholder management.
Strategisch inzicht en het vermogen om technische oplossingen af te stemmen op bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met tal van extralegale voordelen.
Werken in een dynamische, internationale omgeving met tal van groeimogelijkheden.
Flexibele werkuren en de mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (maximaal 3 dagen per week op locatie).
Onderdeel zijn van een innovatief en professioneel team dat werkt aan baanbrekende data-oplossingen.
Interesse? Ben jij de ervaren Senior Data Engineer die wij zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu en word deel van een vooruitstrevend en internationaal team.

3954152167,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/job-data-analist-c2n-brussel-at-belfius-3954152167?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=b4ImMsukSu9i70S4Aj8X6g%3D%3D&trackingId=k%2FHzHqrcRyXG7q6uVm3ZeA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Job | Data Analist C2N | Brussel,Belfius,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Omschrijving
Je levert data-analyses en rapporten op. Zo draag je bij tot de verbetering en monitoring van commerci√´le en operationele prestaties.

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. Vragen vanuit de businessafdelingen (Marketing, Distributie, Contact Center) vertaal je in gedetailleerde data requirements. En je gebruikt de juiste bronnen: sociodemografische bronnen en bronnen in verband met productuitrusting, klantenrentabiliteit, risicoprofielen, onlinegedrag, CRM en verkoopgegevens.

Je staat ook in voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. In samenwerking met de data engineers en gebruikmakend van SQL, Azure en Python bouw je de onderliggende datastructuren op waarop de rapporten zullen draaien en die kunnen dienen voor nieuwe analyses. En je zorgt voor de uitbouw van de visualisaties van de rapporten in dashboards met behulp van QlikSense.
Samen met data governance harmoniseer en centraliseer je ook concepten, met duidelijke owners, stewards en kwaliteitscontroles.
Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn
Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. We zoeken vooral een straffe persoonlijkheid met een learning mindset.
Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan als je iemand bent met:
Een STEM diploma (Science, Technology, Engineer, Mathematichs), of een diploma in handels-/economische wetenschappen en/of relevante werkervaring
Een voorliefde voor cijfers en een sterke analytische capaciteiten
Een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid en een interesse in business en marketing concepten
Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans) en kennis van het Engels
Het vermogen om een massa aan gegevens samen te vatten en om te zetten in kerninzichten
Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen

Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

3804046121,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-h-f-at-littlebigcode-3804046121?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=b4ImMsukSu9i70S4Aj8X6g%3D%3D&trackingId=a3QoMuFyICzIsw688VtjVg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Engineer (H/F),LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a cutting-edge digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence.

Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by collaboratively building impactful applications with our customers, addressing key societal challenges in areas such as health, mobility, and the environment.

We pride ourselves on delivering turnkey projects, offering consulting services, and developing innovative solutions, all while embracing Cloud technologies, AGILE methods, and a DevOps culture for seamless industrialization and scalability.
A vibrant community of over 80 enthusiasts in Data Science & Data Engineering.
International presence and missions ‚Äì we're launching our new office in Belgium!
Engaging workshops, Innovation contests, and successful customer challenges.
Your Role as Data engineer at LittleBigCode :
Working collaboratively in an AGILE environment alongside Data Scientists, architects, and DevOps coaches, your responsibilities will include:
Analyzing strategic challenges related to Data for our customers.
Contributing to defining ambitions and creating Data roadmaps.
Conducting audits and framing projects (architecture, methodology, code quality).
Participating in the development of internal solutions.
Proposing and creating innovative Data solutions.
Hold a Master's in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics).
Possess relevant experience as a Data Engineer.
Proficient in programming languages, especially Python and SQL (Scala is a plus).
Familiar with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Cassandra, Mongo, etc.
Fully conversant with data services of at least one major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP) and various Database types.
Strong understanding of data structuring and modularization concepts.
Experience with ETL processes and setup.

column2: proficiency in Dutch and/or French is a significant advantage.

3971192861,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-expert-at-xquisit-3971192861?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=b4ImMsukSu9i70S4Aj8X6g%3D%3D&trackingId=arkUo4wRDzpGlGOiR3MIig%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Power BI Expert,Xquisit,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Our client's CFO department has an important reporting need in order optimalise the controle and share of financial figures and KPI's. In parallel with this, the demand for reports is constantly growing.
Structure the data inputs to create a new Power BI in order to ensure efficiency and flexibility for potential evolution in the future

Understand the existing reports, propose improvements.
Be able to communicate in a structured and clear manner to the management of the department.

Our client's CFO department has an important reporting need in order optimalise the controle and share of financial figures and KPI's. The reporing occurs today via several Excels with one main datasource. In the coming months we will switch the reporting to a new Power BI. In parallel with this, the demand for reports is constantly growing.

The objectives are

  • Structure the data inputs to create a new Power BI in order to ensure efficiency and flexibility for potential evolution in the future
  • Help and form a business expert to reach autonomy in the maintenance of the PBI
  • Share best practices in PBI structure and use
  • Implement automated versions of reports.
  • Understand the existing reports, propose improvements.
  • Be able to communicate in a structured and clear manner to the management of the department.

Required Skills

  • BI- Reporting Senior (5 y - 8 y)
  • Power BI Senior (5 y - 8 y)
  • MS Office (Mid-level (2 y - 5 y
  • Accurate
  • Analysis
  • Teamplayer
  • Presentation skills

Nice to have:

  • Power Automate Mid-level (2 y - 5 y
  • Insurance knowledge / Financial knowledge

Language skills (speaking, reading and writing):

  • Dutch: fluent
  • French: good
  • English: good

3965198918,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/application-analyst-security-at-bpost-3965198918?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=dnW7VNip5BGTSZbBiOgnIQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Application Analyst Security,bpost,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About the Company

We are looking for an Applications Analyst Security who will manage the applications where security acts as business owner, as well as the interaction of these applications with other departments (e.g. the HR applications, retail planning application, ...). You will work from Brussels.
1. Elaborate the functional needs (user requirements, user management, etc.) in the different security applications:
functional knowledge of the security applications with an end to end view of their operation
clear view of the test environment, working out the user acceptance tests, performing the tests and reporting the test results
provide the necessary support to the testers
2. Consult with IT regarding the concretization of functionalities and versioning:
follow up the IT and business deliverables (scope document, schedule, budget, test scripts...)
Consultation, follow-up, testing (functional and regressive) and validation of developments of the application in which you act as SPOC with ICT
3. Recognize and communicate dependencies between different applications :
organize meetings to follow up on requests for changes and releases
formulating proposals to 'hot fixes' or alternative processes if delivery is delayed
4 Develop and implement reports and documents to manage various activities related to testing:
communication of results and risks to product owners, project leaders, key users and stakeholders
Management of access to applications and reports
5. Identification of opportunities for improvement in terms of efficiency and service of operational processes.
6. Monitor data quality within various applications and also in this regard make proposals for optimization

column2: documentation end to end processes.

column1: 8. Measuring and improving the performance of applications, determining KPI's and SLA's follow-up with ICT bpost and external providers
9. Being attentive to the legal framework that can have an impact on the applications (e.g. GDPR, camera law, etc.).
10. You must show the necessary discretion regarding contacts with government agencies, incidents that have occurred, security measures taken, security audits, security procedures, ...
You must be able to deal with confidential information (badge data, camera images) and so you are a person of integrity.
For the Applications Analyst Security position, we are looking for a dynamic team player with integrity and discretion with the following qualities:
b. Required experience for the position:
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid knowledge of the 2nd national language and good knowledge of English
d. Technical knowledge required for the position:
Sound knowledge of IT release and test management
Building a thorough knowledge of the specific security applications:
In case of urgent incidents, colleagues must be able to call on you

column1: Like many other companies, we offer, in addition to a monthly salary, a wide range of benefits, including meal vouchers, hospitalization insurance, group insurance, disability insurance, 20 days' leave and 7 additional statutory leave days, an end-of-year bonus, double holiday pay and many benefits for more than 100 bpost partners.
This is where we really stand out:
Decisions are taken here in Belgium. At the same time, you are part of an international story, thanks to our many activities in Europe, US and Asia. In your role you will have a direct impact.
You will find yourself in a company in a state of flux. Admittedly, this creates some complexity, but above all a lot of challenges and innovative projects.
The atmosphere, the collegiality and the friendly bpost culture is unique. And we will prove it.
You can focus 100% on your job, with optimal support from all our internal services.

As an international service provider of parcel and e-commerce logistics, we create real connections between millions of people, businesses and communities. Our team of +34,000 employees is our greatest asset in this story. Thanks to them, we continue to play a key role in our rapidly changing society.

About the Company


We are looking for an Applications Analyst Security who will manage the applications where security acts as business owner, as well as the interaction of these applications with other departments (e.g. the HR applications, retail planning application, ...). You will work from Brussels.


Your mission


1. Elaborate the functional needs (user requirements, user management, etc.) in the different security applications:

  • functional knowledge of the security applications with an end to end view of their operation
  • clear view of the test environment, working out the user acceptance tests, performing the tests and reporting the test results
  • provide the necessary support to the testers

2. Consult with IT regarding the concretization of functionalities and versioning:

  • follow up the IT and business deliverables (scope document, schedule, budget, test scripts...)
  • Consultation, follow-up, testing (functional and regressive) and validation of developments of the application in which you act as SPOC with ICT

3. Recognize and communicate dependencies between different applications :

  • organize meetings to follow up on requests for changes and releases
  • centralizing release communication
  • formulating proposals to 'hot fixes' or alternative processes if delivery is delayed

4 Develop and implement reports and documents to manage various activities related to testing:

  • communication of results and risks to product owners, project leaders, key users and stakeholders
  • Management of access to applications and reports

5. Identification of opportunities for improvement in terms of efficiency and service of operational processes.

6. Monitor data quality within various applications and also in this regard make proposals for optimization

7. Create and update user manuals
column2:
documentation end to end processes.

8. Measuring and improving the performance of applications, determining KPI's and SLA's follow-up with ICT bpost and external providers

9. Being attentive to the legal framework that can have an impact on the applications (e.g. GDPR, camera law, etc.).

10. You must show the necessary discretion regarding contacts with government agencies, incidents that have occurred, security measures taken, security audits, security procedures, ...

You must be able to deal with confidential information (badge data, camera images) and so you are a person of integrity.


Your profile


For the Applications Analyst Security position, we are looking for a dynamic team player with integrity and discretion with the following qualities:

a. Education level:

Master

b. Required experience for the position:

At least 3 years of relevant experience

c. Language Skills:

Solid knowledge of the 2nd national language and good knowledge of English

d. Technical knowledge required for the position:

Sound knowledge of desktop applications.

Sound knowledge of IT release and test management

Building a thorough knowledge of the specific security applications:

  • Access control and badge management
  • Alarm system
  • Camera surveillance
  • Cash forecasting
  • Pension management

E. Flexibility:

In case of urgent incidents, colleagues must be able to call on you
column3:
for example, testing on Sundays.


Why bpost?


Like many other companies, we offer, in addition to a monthly salary, a wide range of benefits, including meal vouchers, hospitalization insurance, group insurance, disability insurance, 20 days' leave and 7 additional statutory leave days, an end-of-year bonus, double holiday pay and many benefits for more than 100 bpost partners.

This is where we really stand out:

  • Decisions are taken here in Belgium. At the same time, you are part of an international story, thanks to our many activities in Europe, US and Asia. In your role you will have a direct impact.
  • You will find yourself in a company in a state of flux. Admittedly, this creates some complexity, but above all a lot of challenges and innovative projects.
  • The atmosphere, the collegiality and the friendly bpost culture is unique. And we will prove it.
  • You can focus 100% on your job, with optimal support from all our internal services.

As an international service provider of parcel and e-commerce logistics, we create real connections between millions of people, businesses and communities. Our team of +34,000 employees is our greatest asset in this story. Thanks to them, we continue to play a key role in our rapidly changing society.

3981387068,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-technical-support-analyst-trilogy-remote-%2460-000-year-usd-at-crossover-3981387068?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Otnydocui0vg4JJ4NI1sZg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Senior Technical Support Analyst, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD",Crossover,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

In the fast-paced world of enterprise software, traditional customer support methods often fall short of excellence. Support engineers often find themselves bogged down in repetitive troubleshooting, limited by the narrow scope of their product expertise. Data shows that over 60% of support tickets are escalated due to inadequate problem-solving skills or a lack of product knowledge. This not only frustrates customers but also stifles the growth and satisfaction of support agents.

At Trilogy, we‚Äôve reimagined customer support with the power of AI. Managing over 100 unique enterprise software products, we leverage advanced AI tools to streamline troubleshooting and enhance problem-solving capabilities. Our AI-driven approach not only helps diagnose issues faster but also provides intelligent insights and solutions, making our support team exceptionally efficient and effective. Our AI-powered chatbot crushes most tickets, so only the most complicated customer issues will be escalated to you.

The issues you face in this role will be challenging and diverse, requiring solutions that may involve configuration, database adjustments, or even code-level fixes. This is not a role for those who prefer to stick to familiar routines or spend months mastering a single product. We seek self-starters who can quickly adapt, troubleshoot efficiently, and continuously learn on the job. If you are someone who gets frustrated by rigid processes or needs extensive hand-holding, this is not the right fit for you.

You will be a crucial part of the Trilogy Support team, directly contributing to our reputation for exceptional customer service. This position offers a unique opportunity to advance your career rapidly by developing deep technical expertise across a wide array of products. If you are ready to embrace a challenging yet rewarding role where you can make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply.
AI-Augmented Customer Resolutions: Analyze complex tickets escalated by AI systems, apply human expertise to areas where AI falls short, and then close the gap by improving the AI system
AI Training and Improvement: Review AI-generated solutions and provide detailed feedback and participate in AI model fine-tuning sessions
Cutting-Edge AI Integration: Prototype and test new AI tools and methodologies
Taking two whole months to get up to speed
column2: you will be expected to ramp up one several products within the first month (we are aware this is aggressive)

column1: Relying on your managers for help
column2: if you are not adept at unblocking yourself, you will likely struggle in this role

column1: Senior Technical Support Analyst Key Responsibilities
Integrate technical human expertise and AI capabilities to deliver exceptional customer support, focusing on complex issues that AI cannot yet fully resolve
At least 4 total years of experience in a technical customer support or engineering role
While this is NOT a coding-heavy role, you will still need to be able to read and write code at a basic level for debugging purposes
Experience using generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Bing, Claude, Bard) in a professional setting

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online ‚Äúscreening‚Äù assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as ‚ÄúNot Spam‚Äù since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

3979586741,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ormit-talent-data-traineeship-at-ormit-talent-belgium-3979586741?position=8&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=YwvwLGK97%2Fj79oDvxEb6Ww%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Ormit Talent - Data Traineeship,Ormit Talent Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...
Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That‚Äôs why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.
How special are you? Do the test.
You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We‚Äôll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,‚Ä¶
Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don‚Äôt know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.
What‚Äôs in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills
Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, ‚Ä¶ The common thread: data.
Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you‚Äôre left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF‚Äôs).
Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.
How to become a data chief?
Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, ‚Ä¶) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, ‚Ä¶) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, ‚Ä¶
And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring
We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...


Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That‚Äôs why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.



How special are you? Do the test.

  • You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
  • A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We‚Äôll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
  • Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
  • You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,‚Ä¶
  • Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
  • You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don‚Äôt know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.



What‚Äôs in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills

  • Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
  • Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, ‚Ä¶ The common thread: data.
  • Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
  • Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
  • Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you‚Äôre left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF‚Äôs).
  • Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
  • Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.



How to become a data chief?

  • Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, ‚Ä¶) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, ‚Ä¶) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
  • Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, ‚Ä¶
  • And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring



Ask us!

We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Contact our recruiters : recruitment@ormittalent.be

Position: Senior Business Analyst, Expert in Power BI
You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.

Technical and Soft Skills: As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex business problems and translating them into actionable insights using the Power BI platform. You will work closely with various stakeholders to gather requirements, design and develop reports and dashboards, and provide data-driven recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.
Bachelor's degree i Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a strong focus on data analysis and visualization using Power BI.
Proven experience in Power BI architecture and development, including the ability to design and develop complex data models, reports, dashboards, and interactive visuals.
Proficiency in writing DAX queries and utilizing advanced features in Power BI.
Solid understanding of data integration techniques, including ETL processes and data modeling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to transform business requirements into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English (C2 level) and is a plus a proficient in Dutch or French (B2 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already
Design and develop Power BI reports and dashboards that provide clear, concise, and actionable information to support business decision-making.
Build and maintain data models and data integration workflows in Power BI to ensure accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaborate with data engineers and database administrators to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Perform data cleansing and validation to ensure data quality and integrity.
Continuously monitor and analyze data trends, identifying areas of improvement and making recommendations for process enhancement.
International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.
Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.
Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.
Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.
Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.

3951969557,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-statistician-at-eortc-european-organisation-for-research-and-treatment-of-cancer-3951969557?position=3&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=qaBd3cXbUfedvYVD5Tc9Cw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Senior Statistician,EORTC - European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Senior Statistician

The Senior Statistician supports the statistical activities for one or several EORTC Groups or Task Forces and/or identified EORTC transversal projects. The Senior Statistician works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.

The Senior statistician complies with EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. He/she is also responsible to safeguard the compliance of his/her collaborators with the EORTC Policies and principles of conduct.
The senior statistician may be helped in his/her tasks by statistical fellows and/or statistical analysts and/or statisticians.
Responsibilities in studies and research projects
The senior statistician is accountable for the development, the conduct, analysis and reporting of his/her studies and research projects, as detailed in the Standard Operating Procedures, including
Development of case report forms and any activities required for the set-up of a study in collaboration with other departments
Communication with the EORTC Independent Data Monitoring Committee Support Unit
Supporting the medical staff in the interpretation and framing of results
Preparation of material for presentation of results to conferences
Submission of clinical trial results to regulators (EudraCT, clinicaltrials.gov)
Actively participates to the bi-weekly meetings of the statistics department and to the internal protocol review meetings
Ensures the up-to-date knowledge of the statistical techniques necessary for the proper design and the analysis of clinical trials
Gives lectures during educational sessions or courses organized by or with EORTC
May train and oversee the activities of fellow statisticians
Write and maintain Work Instructions and/or Standard Operating Procedures

The position is open for candidates with an MSc, PhD or ScD degree in biostatistics or statistics with at least 5 years of experience in clinical trials research (preferably oncology). In addition, the position requires:
Experience in the design of (preferably oncology) clinical trials and in survival analysis is mandatory
Proficiency in the use of SAS
column2: experience with R is an asset

column1: Knowledge in health-related quality of life and/or health technology assessment is an asset
Good communication skills in both oral and written English
Ability to work in an international multidisciplinary environment
Capable of presenting and debating projects with partners
Dynamic and capable of working autonomously
Motivated by the mission of EORTC
Wage according to our Non-Profit organisation status

Senior Statistician

The Senior Statistician supports the statistical activities for one or several EORTC Groups or Task Forces and/or identified EORTC transversal projects. The Senior Statistician works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.


The Senior statistician complies with EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. He/she is also responsible to safeguard the compliance of his/her collaborators with the EORTC Policies and principles of conduct.


The senior statistician may be helped in his/her tasks by statistical fellows and/or statistical analysts and/or statisticians.


Main responsibilities / Major Activities


Responsibilities in studies and research projects


The senior statistician is accountable for the development, the conduct, analysis and reporting of his/her studies and research projects, as detailed in the Standard Operating Procedures, including


  • Development of study design
  • Development and review of protocols
  • Development of case report forms and any activities required for the set-up of a study in collaboration with other departments
  • Development of statistical analysis plans
  • Communication with the EORTC Independent Data Monitoring Committee Support Unit
  • Programming and reporting of studies
  • Supporting the medical staff in the interpretation and framing of results
  • Writing sections of manuscripts
  • Review of manuscripts
  • Preparation of material for presentation of results to conferences
  • Submission of clinical trial results to regulators (EudraCT, clinicaltrials.gov)


Responsibilities in the statistics department


  • Actively participates to the bi-weekly meetings of the statistics department and to the internal protocol review meetings
  • Ensures the up-to-date knowledge of the statistical techniques necessary for the proper design and the analysis of clinical trials
  • Gives lectures during educational sessions or courses organized by or with EORTC
  • May train and oversee the activities of fellow statisticians
  • Write and maintain Work Instructions and/or Standard Operating Procedures


Profile

The position is open for candidates with an MSc, PhD or ScD degree in biostatistics or statistics with at least 5 years of experience in clinical trials research (preferably oncology). In addition, the position requires:

  • Experience in the design of (preferably oncology) clinical trials and in survival analysis is mandatory
  • Proficiency in the use of SAS
column2:
experience with R is an asset
  • Experience with CDISC/ADAM
  • Knowledge in health-related quality of life and/or health technology assessment is an asset
  • Good communication skills in both oral and written English
  • Ability to work in an international multidisciplinary environment
  • Capable of presenting and debating projects with partners
  • Able to write scientific communications
  • Dynamic and capable of working autonomously
  • Team player
  • Motivated by the mission of EORTC


    • Benefits

    • Permanent contract
    • Wage according to our Non-Profit organisation status
    • Hybrid working environment (from Belgium)
    • 30 days holidays (full time)
    • Meal vouchers
    • Pension plan
    • Hospitalisation insurance and ambulatory care
    • Homeworking allowance
    • Reimbursement of public transport
    • Free parking

Je maakt deel uit van het Infrastructuur team: Distributed & Network
Je beheert IT-systemen en -infrastructuur, controleert kwaliteitsnormen en beheert databases.
Je maakt deel uit van het derdelijns supportteam dat tot doel heeft jouw medewerkers en IT-collega's te helpen bij het gebruik van de gehele infrastructuur (netwerk, servers en applicaties).
Je test, valideert en implementeert wijzigingen in de systemen, voert updates uit en documenteert deze.
Je zult in staat zijn om je taken zowel in teamverband als zelfstandig uit te voeren.
Nacht- en weekenddiensten met het team zijn eveneens vereist.
Je hebt een bachelor in informatica behaald of heb gelijkwaardige relevante ervaring.
Je bent oplossingsgericht, communicatief, stressbestendig, flexibel en beschikt over een goede teamspirit.
Je hebt kennis van of een certificaat behaald op √©√©n, maar bij voorkeur op meerdere, van volgende domeinen:
Je hebt een verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en bent in staat om initiatief te nemen
Je toont flexibiliteit wanneer de werkdruk dit rechtvaardigt
Je bent proactief, hebt zin voor initiatief en weet de juiste prioriteiten te stellen.
Je hebt een basiskennis van ITIL
Je werkt onder de supervisie van de Teamlead Distributed & Network en van de Infrastructuur manager.
Je spreekt vloeiend Frans of Nederlands met een passieve kennis van de tweede taal, kennis van het Engels is een extra troef.

De informatica-afdeling van Solidaris Nationaal Verbond van Socialistische mutualiteiten bestaat uit een 200-tal IT-ers die toepassingen ontwikkelen voor alle aangesloten ziekenfondsen, hun loketten (800) en binnendiensten, verspreid over heel Belgi√´. Deze toepassingen worden gebruikt door meer dan 3500 personen en maken dagelijks ongeveer 4 miljoen transacties mogelijk.
Betekenisvol werk: Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van de gezondheid en het welzijn van mensen. Je kunt trots zijn op het feit dat je een positieve impact hebt op het leven van anderen.

Professionele ontwikkeling: Wij bieden een stimulerende omgeving waarin je je professioneel kunt ontwikkelen. Er zijn tal van mogelijkheden voor training, vorming en loopbaangroei, zodat je je vaardigheden voortdurend kunt verbeteren en je carri√®re kunt laten evolueren.

Flexibiliteit en balans: Wij begrijpen het belang van een gezonde balans tussen werk en priv√©leven. Een 36 uren werkweek met vrije namiddag, 6 adv-dagen, extra legale verlofdagen die meegroeien met jouw anci√´nniteit, glijdende werkuren en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk bieden een omgeving die rekening houdt met jouw behoeften.

Uitgebreide voordelen: Naast het salarispakket zijn er diverse extra-legale voordelen, waaronder maaltijdcheques, groepsverzekering, vergoeding van woon/werkverkeer (aan tarief openbaar vervoer), een hospitalisatieverzekering, mogelijkheid tot fietsleasing en verschillende personeelskortingen.
Samenwerking en teamgeest: Er heerst een sterke teamgeest en er zijn regelmatig activiteiten en evenementen om de onderlinge band te versterken.

Op basis van je motivatiebrief en CV gebeurt een eerste selectie. Zo krijg je meteen antwoord en plannen we eventueel een gesprek in. Van zodra wij de geschikte kandidaat vinden sluiten wij de vacature af.
Solliciteren doe je via de sollicitatieknop. Voeg zeker ook je cv en motivatiebrief toe.
Voor bijkomende inlichtingen over de functie contacteer je Laurent Lauvax, teamleader IT distributed & network (Laurent.Lauvaux@solidaris.be)
Voor algemene informatie over Solidaris ga je naar www.solidaris-vlaanderen.be. Volg ons ook op LinkedIn en Twitter.
Wij moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren. Kwaliteiten en competenties zijn belangrijker dan afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht of arbeidshandicap.

3980198118,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-engineer-at-salt-3980198118?position=6&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=nIwx4F4lRFtT%2FGz9dIARCQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Senior Data Engineer,Salt,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Senior Data Engineer (ETL,ELT) ‚Äì Banking ‚Äì Brussels

My banking client is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join on a freelance mission. They want someone who can you autonomously craft, develop and deploy data pipelines, making sure these pipelines are filled with qualitative data which serve as an input for our machine learning engineers.

In this role, You collaborate closely with our machine learning engineers and/or cloud architects on projects, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. You will support the reporting teams in the data exploration and data preparation phases, Implement data quality controls. You will liaise with IT infrastructure teams to address infrastructure issues and to ensure that the components and software used on our different platforms are all consistent.
As a senior Data engineer you will also build and share knowledge with your junior colleagues.
Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK.

Experience with analysis and creation of data pipelines, data architecture, ETL/ELT development and with processing structured and unstructured data, including post-go live activities Ability to analyse data, identify issues (e.g. gaps, inconsistencies) and you can solve them
Experience using data stored in RDBMSs and experience or some understanding of NoSQL databases
You have knowledge of Scala and Spark, and a good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including Hadoop file formats like Parquet and ORC
You can write performant Scala code and SQL statements and can design modular, future proof solutions that are fit for purpose
You are autonomous in working on IBM Mainframe & Unix based systems.
You have a true agile approach, capable and willing to tackle tasks outside of their strengths to help the team
Experience in working with customers to identify and clarify requirements
Strong curiosity about FINTECH and technologies related data.
You speak English fluently, any other language is a plus!

Senior Data Engineer (ETL,ELT) ‚Äì Banking ‚Äì Brussels

Day rate: ‚Ç¨600 - ‚Ç¨800

Duration: 12 months

Start: ASAP


My banking client is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join on a freelance mission. They want someone who can you autonomously craft, develop and deploy data pipelines, making sure these pipelines are filled with qualitative data which serve as an input for our machine learning engineers.

In this role, You collaborate closely with our machine learning engineers and/or cloud architects on projects, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. You will support the reporting teams in the data exploration and data preparation phases, Implement data quality controls. You will liaise with IT infrastructure teams to address infrastructure issues and to ensure that the components and software used on our different platforms are all consistent.

As a senior Data engineer you will also build and share knowledge with your junior colleagues.


Job requirements

Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK.


The Skills

  • Experience with analysis and creation of data pipelines, data architecture, ETL/ELT development and with processing structured and unstructured data, including post-go live activities Ability to analyse data, identify issues (e.g. gaps, inconsistencies) and you can solve them
  • Experience using data stored in RDBMSs and experience or some understanding of NoSQL databases
  • You have knowledge of Scala and Spark, and a good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including Hadoop file formats like Parquet and ORC
  • You can write performant Scala code and SQL statements and can design modular, future proof solutions that are fit for purpose
  • You are autonomous in working on IBM Mainframe &
column2:
Unix based systems.
  • You have a true agile approach, capable and willing to tackle tasks outside of their strengths to help the team
  • Experience in working with customers to identify and clarify requirements
  • Strong curiosity about FINTECH and technologies related data.
  • You have good communication skills!


    • Nice to haves

    • Knowledge of Cloudera, IBM mainframe
    • You speak English fluently, any other language is a plus!

üî•Keywords: IT Functional analyst, API Services, IT System, integration and assembly testing

Sector: Our client is a prominent player in the financial sector, recognized for its comprehensive range of banking and financial services. With a global presence, it serves a diverse clientele, including individuals, corporations, and institutions. Emphasizing innovation and customer-centricity, it leverages advanced technologies to deliver tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of its stakeholders.

The Functional Analyst clearly identifies the problems that the business are experiencing and/or the business requirements and maps out possible solutions that can be developed and integrated in the enterprise production environment. The Functional Analyst investigates costs and benefits. The Functional Analyst consequently designs the chosen solution in detail, defining exactly what it should look like, which data are involved, and which processes are supported.
Functional and technical knowledge of existing IT systems. Creation of swagger files and Creation of API services

Accompany the business analyst and client through the reflection towards a solution ‚Äì propose alternative and adequate solutions in line with enterprise architecture and strategy and considering cost/benefit.
Ensure that the client understands and adopts enterprise rules and standards concerning architectural standards, security, ‚Ä¶
Work together with the architects to set up the architecture
Close collaboration with project manager / asset manager / product owner

Relay between the client, business analyst and involved asset teams, coordination of the involved asset teams (unified view towards the client ‚Äì ensure that all involved IT parties clearly understand the client needs)
Functional elaboration of the chosen solution alternative, translation of the business requirements in detailed functional requirements
Align with involved assets on the functional responsibilities each asset will need to implement
Application design of the solution, identifying and detailing the impacts on the different application components as specified in the architecture
Align with the different technical teams of the asset to specify each of their requirements
Follow-up of development and testing to ensure coherence between the functional specifications and the developed solution
Provide the technical definitions of components that are supported by different teams (queues, security, integration layers, ‚Ä¶)
Support suppliers during the development and integration and assembly testing (I&AT) Analyze defects during test phase
Support the release and deployment teams in the different environments
thirst for knowledge: Agile is about learning and adapting. Knowledge sharing is key to success.

The goal of team success: Agile is about the success of the team, no individual success or heroic behavior. It is more important for the team to succeed than for the individual to have completed his/her tasks.
There is no failure, only feedback: Agile is about taking everything as lessons, adjusting actions based on the feedback, resulting in continuous improvement.

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.
Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.
Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.

column2: any other language is an asset.

column1: Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.

As a fast-growing team based in Z√ºrich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.

Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database‚Äîa comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.
Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.
Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Job Description: Data Analyst ‚Äì Metals Sector


We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.


Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:

Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.

Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.

  • Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
  • Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
  • Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
  • Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
  • Proficiency in English

3981247594,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sustainability-data-analyst-at-emea-recruitment-3981247594?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=RaXHzNvTFp3QeNr3Zx2a4Q%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Sustainability Data Analyst,EMEA Recruitment,"Zurich, Switzerland","My client is a global leader in the FMCG industry who are outgrowing the market within their industry by continuously adding to their innovative portfolio. My client is seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst on a 3-6 month contract, who can help monitor the ESG & Sustainability data within their portfolio of suppliers.
The Sustainability Data Analyst report into the VP of Sustainability you will be acquiring data from some of their largest suppliers to ensure compliance and ESG standards throughout.
This role is based in Switzerland and can be fully remote.
As the Sustainability Data Analyst you will be the go to contact for any queries from suppliers within Carlsberg‚Äôs portfolio regarding Sustainability & Regulatory data.
By analysing the data you will identify trends, errors and gaps within the reports/templates from the suppliers to increase awareness & key areas of improvement for the sustainability team.
Help contribute to the organisations overall ESG & Sustainability strategy by gaining valuable data insights throughout the organisation‚Äôs portfolio.
Being the main point of contact for any queries or questions around the suppliers ESG & Sustainability reporting templates as they are being introduced.
Accountable for monitoring Sustainability data through the organisation‚Äôs suppliers.
Manage the Sustainability reports for 30-40 accounts to have full visibility of the organisation‚Äôs portfolio ESG & Sustainability status.
Communicate with clients on how to correctly input data for the Sustainability reports.
Present recommended data to the Sustainability team through Excel identifying key trends.
Understanding of Procurement/Supply Chain suppliers. (Experience is desired, not a must)
Strong Communicator, with the ability to present and work with senior Stakeholders.
Degree in Business Administration, Sustainability or Energy. (Desired)
If you are interested in applying for this role, please register your interest using the link in the below comments. Alternatively, please send your CV to benjamin.betts@emearecruitment.com
If you do not hear from us within two weeks, unfortunately, you have been unsuccessful. To be assured of a response, please apply via emearecruitment.com

3959552371,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-24-months-at-panerai-3959552371?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=mnv6c8PtemVCySWB8%2Bs4QQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst (24 months),Panerai,"Neuch√¢tel, Neuch√¢tel, Switzerland","In order to reinforce our Operations Data team, within our Supply Chain department we are currently recruiting a:

Within our integrated end-to-end Supply Chain, you will be in charge of developing and maintaining analytics reports to facilitate decision making for the department, and ensure data integrity and quality. This role is committed to leveraging data to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of main internal processes. It involves tasks like analyzing data to identify trends and inefficiencies, developing data-driven recommendations for improvement, and creating reports and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders. Ultimately, your goal will be to use data to streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT ?
Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to gather and analyze data on procurement, inventory management, warehousing, production, and sales.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and root causes of inefficiencies.
Maintain established portfolio of data-driven solutions to optimize Supply Chain processes, such as forecasting models for demand planning and inventory management strategies.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate complex data insights to stakeholders across different departments.
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Supply Chain initiatives.
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis trends and technologies.
Partner with other Business Analysts from other departments including IT, Commercial, Finance, and Operations
Master degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Proven previous experience with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Power BI and Python
Previous experience with Google Cloud ecosystem is a plus
Strong understanding of statistical analysis concepts
Experience working in a Supply Chain environment is a plus
Comfortable in changing and evolving contexts
Strong communication skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and teams
How Do We Keep You Smiling
You will be part of a dynamic Maison where your skills and talents will be recognized
You will share with us the same values as ""enriching communities, care attitude, continuous improvement, efficient accountability""
You will work in a multicultural team and develop international experience
You will navigate with us on our sustainability journey
You will develop and take your career at the next level with potential opportunities within the Maison and the Richemont Group
1st stage - After your application has been selected, our recruitment team will reach out to you within 2 weeks to conduct an introductury call
2nd stage - Interview with the Line Manager
3rd stage - Interview with the HR Manager / Director

Panerai is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We want to offer an inclusive environment of mutual respect and we are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination based on gender, gender expression, disability, origin, background, religious beliefs or sexual orientation or any other basis protected by law.

In order to reinforce our Operations Data team, within our Supply Chain department we are currently recruiting a:

Data Analyst

Your Mission

Within our integrated end-to-end Supply Chain, you will be in charge of developing and maintaining analytics reports to facilitate decision making for the department, and ensure data integrity and quality. This role is committed to leveraging data to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of main internal processes. It involves tasks like analyzing data to identify trends and inefficiencies, developing data-driven recommendations for improvement, and creating reports and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders. Ultimately, your goal will be to use data to streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT ?

  • Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to gather and analyze data on procurement, inventory management, warehousing, production, and sales.
  • Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and root causes of inefficiencies.
  • Maintain established portfolio of data-driven solutions to optimize Supply Chain processes, such as forecasting models for demand planning and inventory management strategies.
  • Create clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate complex data insights to stakeholders across different departments.
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Supply Chain initiatives.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis trends and technologies.
  • Partner with other Business Analysts from other departments including IT, Commercial, Finance, and Operations

How Will You Experience Success

  • Master degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
  • Proven previous experience with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Power BI and Python
  • Previous experience with Google Cloud ecosystem is a plus
  • Strong understanding of statistical analysis concepts
  • Microsoft office expert, especially Excel
  • Experience working in a Supply Chain environment is a plus
  • Fluent French, advanced English
  • Analytical &
column2:
synthetic mindset
  • Autonomous, results-driven, rigorous and proactive
  • Comfortable in changing and evolving contexts
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and teams

    • You will share with us the same values as ""enriching communities, care attitude, continuous improvement, efficient accountability""
    • You will work in a multicultural team and develop international experience
    • You will navigate with us on our sustainability journey
    • You will develop and take your career at the next level with potential opportunities within the Maison and the Richemont Group

    INTERVIEW PROCESS

    1st stage - After your application has been selected, our recruitment team will reach out to you within 2 weeks to conduct an introductury call

    2nd stage - Interview with the Line Manager

    3rd stage - Interview with the HR Manager / Director

    Panerai is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We want to offer an inclusive environment of mutual respect and we are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination based on gender, gender expression, disability, origin, background, religious beliefs or sexual orientation or any other basis protected by law.
