3978983794,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-technology-staffing-group-3978983794?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=JywCAA8lJIYAWBynN3l5aA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Technology Staffing Group,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","About TSG

Technology Staffing Group SA is a Swiss IT consulting group based in Geneva. Expertise in hiring IT talents as well as co-leading projects for our clients which include start-ups to Fortune 500 companies that are based across Europe. Today, more than 100 employees across Europe support our clients in accelerating and transforming their organizations.

For our clients' team, focusing on the healthcare sector, we are seeking Senior and Junior Data Analysts with experience in business analysis and BI tool implementation. This role will be pivotal in driving data-driven decisions and optimizing business performance through advanced analytics.
Minimum 2 years of experience in business analysis, focusing on business activity management
Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in implementing BI tools, particularly QlikView or QlikSense
Expertise in data warehouse modeling and design, with a strong understanding of data integration and ETL processes
Familiarity with conventional statistical tools such as SAS or R is advantageous
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to solve complex problems and communicate findings effectively
Understand and articulate business requirements, translating them into data requirements and actionable insights
Implement and optimize BI tools such as QlikView or QlikSense to create interactive dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights
Design and develop data warehouse models that support the organization's analytical needs and business objectives
Apply statistical tools and techniques to analyze complex datasets and derive valuable insights
Collaborate closely with business teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions
Contribute to the improvement of data quality and integrity through data validation and cleansing activities.
Master's degree in computer science or an equivalent qualification
Our team of recruitment managers is your first point of contact. Their role is to understand your background, to consider your life project and your expectations to offer you missions that suit you.
Depending on your area of expertise, we offer the opportunity to discuss technical topics with one of our colleagues.

Context, constitution of the team in place, objectives, technical expertise requested, challenges to be met: this interview with a Business Manager allows you to better know the assignment or projects on which we could be required to work together.
You will finally have interviews with our clients to meet your future teammates and better understand your work assignment environment.
Your profile is accepted by one of our clients? Congrats and welcome to the TSG community!
By submitting your resume, you accept that the data entered will be retained, reused by TSG to contact you and shared with our clients in the context of your request.

About TSG

Technology Staffing Group SA is a Swiss IT consulting group based in Geneva. Expertise in hiring IT talents as well as co-leading projects for our clients which include start-ups to Fortune 500 companies that are based across Europe. Today, more than 100 employees across Europe support our clients in accelerating and transforming their organizations.

For our clients' team, focusing on the healthcare sector, we are seeking Senior and Junior Data Analysts with experience in business analysis and BI tool implementation. This role will be pivotal in driving data-driven decisions and optimizing business performance through advanced analytics.

Position

  • Data Analyst


Experience Required

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in business analysis, focusing on business activity management
  • Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in implementing BI tools, particularly QlikView or QlikSense
  • Expertise in data warehouse modeling and design, with a strong understanding of data integration and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with conventional statistical tools such as SAS or R is advantageous
  • Strong analytical mindset with the ability to solve complex problems and communicate findings effectively


Main Responsibilities

  • Understand and articulate business requirements, translating them into data requirements and actionable insights
  • Implement and optimize BI tools such as QlikView or QlikSense to create interactive dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights
  • Design and develop data warehouse models that support the organization's analytical needs and business objectives
  • Apply statistical tools and techniques to analyze complex datasets and derive valuable insights
  • Collaborate closely with business teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions
  • Contribute to the improvement of data quality and integrity through data validation and cleansing activities.


Education/Certification

  • Master's degree in computer science or an equivalent qualification


Languages

  • French: Native/Fluent
  • English: Fluent


Next steps

  • Our team of recruitment managers is your first point of contact. Their role is to understand your background, to consider your life project and your expectations to offer you missions that suit you.
  • Depending on your area of expertise, we offer the opportunity to discuss technical topics with one of our colleagues.
  • Context, constitution of the team in place, objectives, technical expertise requested, challenges to be met: this interview with a Business Manager allows you to better know the assignment or projects on which we could be required to work together.
  • You will finally have interviews with our clients to meet your future teammates and better understand your work assignment environment.
  • Your profile is accepted by one of our clients? Congrats and welcome to the TSG community!


Your personal data

  • By submitting your resume, you accept that the data entered will be retained, reused by TSG to contact you and shared with our clients in the context of your request.

3976535211,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-data-analyst-100%25-w-m-d-at-properti-3976535211?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=tNXzb8N6q4dFEBdcM5RIRw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"BI Data Analyst 100% (w,m,d)",properti,"Zurich, Switzerland","Properti, established at the end of 2019, has swiftly become a leading proptech firm in Switzerland. Our ambitious mission is to drive sustainable change in the real estate market. Keywords like transparency, sustainability, youthfulness, and innovation epitomize our core values. Beyond offering comprehensive real estate sales and rental services, we position ourselves as holistic partners in every sense. Our foundation rests on knowledge, experience, integrity, and an extensive network.

Are you ready to grow with a dynamic, youthful company? Are you eager to join our European expansion and make a significant impact? At Properti, you won't just be a number‚Äîyou'll actively contribute to our mission. Our philosophy not only challenges employees but also empowers them to thrive!

As a BI Analyst at Properti, you'll play a crucial role in analyzing business data and generating valuable insights. You‚Äôll work closely with our Sales Teams, Strategy & Growth team and data engineers to create impactful solutions that lead to informed decision making and strategic planning. This position is based in our Z√ºrich headquarters.
Collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that will support business growth
Creating and maintaining data models, databases, and central dashboards to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborating with stakeholders and data scientists to establish business goals, metrics, and requirements and then translate these specifics into business analysis solutions
Conducting data quality checks while ensuring data integrity and accuracy across all spectrums before implementing findings
Developing reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate strategic findings and presenting these insights as recommendations to key stakeholders to aid business decisions
Identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization based on data insights
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or Master‚Äôs degree) in a field such as data analytics, statistics, business administration, mathematics, computer science, data science or a related discipline is preferred
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, information technology, or a related field of data management
Strong technical skills in data collection, data mining, and statistical modeling techniques
Work experience with programming languages and tools such as SQL, Python, R and simple analytics tools such as Excel
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView to create compelling visualizations and reports
Understanding of database concepts such as database structures, query languages, and data warehousing principles
Experience handling business intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Oracle Business Intelligence, IBM Cognos to extract and analyze data
Experience with information systems in the context of machine learning, big data, or AI is a strong advantage
Commitment to continuous learning and willingness to stay updated on emerging industry trends, business processes, technologies, and methodologies in the data field
Strong analytical skills: You are able to break down complex problems in a data analyst role, analyze data effectively, and derive meaningful insights are all keys to success in this role
Attention to detail: You must be meticulous and thorough throughout the data analysis process, ensuring accuracy in reporting and recommendations
Critical thinking: You use strategic thinking to evaluate information objectively and assess alternative solutions to make informed decisions
Effective communication skills: Your ability to convey complex technical terms to non-technical team members is an essential part of the role, communicating findings in a clear and concise manner
Collaboration and teamwork: You‚Äôre a team player, always willing to work with cross-functional and global teams, share knowledge, and contribute to collective goals
Problem-solving skills: You can identify and define problems, analyze root causes, and develop innovative solutions based on strategic insights
Project management: You are able to coordinate complex projects beyond the scope of business analytics, ensuring timely roll-out and consistently meeting goals and expectations
Promotion: above-average career opportunities & talent promotion
Doer mentality: young and innovative company, embedded in an agile, flat entrepreneurial culture
Properti Academy: access to our internal academy in the field of real estate
Properti Coaching: internal professional contact point with own psychologist
Modern working environment: flexible working hours with the possibility of home office
Food & Drinks: fresh fruits & snacks, coffee & tea, drinks & after workbeer
Birthday Retreat: half day free of charge
Loyalty: 5 weeks vacation, plus unlimited (unpaid) vacations
Teambuilding: Rocket Friday, summer & winter event, incentive trips

Properti, established at the end of 2019, has swiftly become a leading proptech firm in Switzerland. Our ambitious mission is to drive sustainable change in the real estate market. Keywords like transparency, sustainability, youthfulness, and innovation epitomize our core values. Beyond offering comprehensive real estate sales and rental services, we position ourselves as holistic partners in every sense. Our foundation rests on knowledge, experience, integrity, and an extensive network.


Are you ready to grow with a dynamic, youthful company? Are you eager to join our European expansion and make a significant impact? At Properti, you won't just be a number‚Äîyou'll actively contribute to our mission. Our philosophy not only challenges employees but also empowers them to thrive!

Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights.
Develop and implement advanced data models and algorithms to solve business problems.
Utilize Databricks for data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to visualize key metrics and trends.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data science.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in the Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking.
Strong expertise in Databricks, including data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Proficient in Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Certification in Databricks, Power BI is a plus.

To join our team dedicated to our Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking customers, we are looking for a Databricks, Power BI Consultant (F/M).


Your Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights.
  • Develop and implement advanced data models and algorithms to solve business problems.
  • Utilize Databricks for data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to visualize key metrics and trends.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
  • Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data science.

Your Profile:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in the Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking.
  • Strong expertise in Databricks, including data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
  • Proficient in Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
  • Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.

3958648535,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-vf-corporation-3958648535?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=AlW7Ba6BQhZxCP1pOj6rWg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Analyst,VF Corporation,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.
We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:
An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus
Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks
This post is not eligible for relocation support.

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.


Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.


Job Details


We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

  • Gather and understand Business Requirements
  • Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
  • Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
  • Implement reports as a Superuser
  • Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges


Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:


  • An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
  • A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
  • Understanding of Data Modeling principles
  • Hands-on experience in data investigations
  • Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
  • Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
  • Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
  • Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus


Other key skills for success:


  • Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
  • Ability to handle Change Management
  • Focus on the end-user community
  • Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Analytical mindset
  • Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
  • Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
  • Fluency in spoken and written English


VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com


What‚Äôs In It For You

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.


  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
  • Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
  • On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
  • Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks


This post is not eligible for relocation support.


Free to Be, Inclusion &
column2:
Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.


As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.


If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

3982006162,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analysis-expert-at-mygwork-lgbtq%2B-business-community-3982006162?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=bWABmPq7TkBKynQfS2%2FD6w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data analysis expert,myGwork - LGBTQ+ Business Community,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

The individual contractor will support the Secretariat of the Minamata Convention, under the supervision of the Senior Programme Management Officer (Science and Technology), in the management, analysis and visualization of quantitative and qualitative data related to mercury monitoring data, emission and release data, in combination with other data such as mercury supply, demand and trade and control measures.

Under the supervision of the Senior Programme Management Officer, the individual contractor will perform the following tasks: A. Support to the development of mercury emission and release data summary - Analysis of data submitted to the OESG data repository - Analysis of mercury emission and release data available in the public domain - Visualization of available mercury emission and release data - Drafting of the emission and release data summary report - Development of a concept for interactive data management and visualization tool B. Support to the development of mercury monitoring data summary - Analysis of data submitted to the OESG data repository - Analysis of mercury monitoring data available in the public domain - Visualization of available mercury monitoring data - Drafting of the mercury monitoring data summary report - Development of a concept for interactive data management and visualization tool C. Other support to the Open-ended Scientific Group - Support to online meetings including note taking, document sharing and follow up. - Support to the drafting of data analysis report, including the communication with authors, commenting by OESG members and revisions responding to comments - Support to regular communication of the OESG members.

Academic Qualifications: An advanced university degree in data science, data analytics, applied mathematics, information management, data analytics, or related area. Experience: A minimum of five years of experience in data science, data analytics, applied mathematics, information management, data analytics, or related area. Experience in environmental data is an advantage.
Language: Fluency in English is essential. Knowledge of other official United Nations languages is an advantage.

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS‚Äô BANK ACCOUNTS.

This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Result of Service

The individual contractor will support the Secretariat of the Minamata Convention, under the supervision of the Senior Programme Management Officer (Science and Technology), in the management, analysis and visualization of quantitative and qualitative data related to mercury monitoring data, emission and release data, in combination with other data such as mercury supply, demand and trade and control measures.

Home based

Expected duration

4 months

Duties And Responsibilities

Under the supervision of the Senior Programme Management Officer, the individual contractor will perform the following tasks: A. Support to the development of mercury emission and release data summary - Analysis of data submitted to the OESG data repository - Analysis of mercury emission and release data available in the public domain - Visualization of available mercury emission and release data - Drafting of the emission and release data summary report - Development of a concept for interactive data management and visualization tool B. Support to the development of mercury monitoring data summary - Analysis of data submitted to the OESG data repository - Analysis of mercury monitoring data available in the public domain - Visualization of available mercury monitoring data - Drafting of the mercury monitoring data summary report - Development of a concept for interactive data management and visualization tool C. Other support to the Open-ended Scientific Group - Support to online meetings including note taking, document sharing and follow up. - Support to the drafting of data analysis report, including the communication with authors, commenting by OESG members and revisions responding to comments - Support to regular communication of the OESG members.

Qualifications/special Skills

Academic Qualifications: An advanced university degree in data science, data analytics, applied mathematics, information management, data analytics, or related area. Experience: A minimum of five years of experience in data science, data analytics, applied mathematics, information management, data analytics, or related area. Experience in environmental data is an advantage.

Languages

Language: Fluency in English is essential. Knowledge of other official United Nations languages is an advantage.

Additional Information

Not available.

No Fee

3970215010,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analytics-zurich-switzerland-at-partners-group-3970215010?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=e6tx0NsLZ%2BOeSZQgvwKEYw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Internship - Data Analytics (Zurich, Switzerland)",Partners Group,"Zug, Zug, Switzerland","What It's About
We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months
The Main Tasks Will Be The Following
Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards.

Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication & mapping logic to be applied during data integration & mastering.

Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.
Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree
Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory
Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills
Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task
Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed
Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms
Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers
Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All g enuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com

  • Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication &

mastering.

3970870411,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-market-data-analyst-6-months-at-lombard-odier-group-3970870411?position=22&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=DIo5Wkzz5BI1PIVNU49%2BVQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Internship - Market Data Analyst (6 months),Lombard Odier Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

You will integrate the Financial Information team section within the Technology and Operations Unit based in Geneva. The members of this team ensure the management, the financial monitoring of the infrastructures and the services related to financial information data for the Group. The group spans 25 offices worldwide operating in the sectors of Private Banking, Asset Management and Business Outsourcing, with it‚Äôs headquarter in Geneva, Switzerland.
Assist members of the team in the reporting to the Group‚Äôs business divisions on their market data usage
Assist in the projects to optimize financial data usage throughout the group
Work on specific market data related projects, tasks and requests.
A keen interest in data, more specifically financial market data
Exceptional analytical abilities, including the interpretation of large data sets and deciphering the findings into clear messages and visuals
Strong MS Excel skills and Tableau is preferred, and experience using SQL and VBA
Collaborative team player with the ability to work independently
Ability to take ownership of tasks from the beginning through to conclusion
Meticulous, proactive and able to multi-task
Resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate to Switzerland.

Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.
It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.


With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.


‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.



Internship - Market Data Analyst (6 months)


You will integrate the Financial Information team section within the Technology and Operations Unit based in Geneva. The members of this team ensure the management, the financial monitoring of the infrastructures and the services related to financial information data for the Group. The group spans 25 offices worldwide operating in the sectors of Private Banking, Asset Management and Business Outsourcing, with it‚Äôs headquarter in Geneva, Switzerland.


YOUR ROLE

  • Assist members of the team in the reporting to the Group‚Äôs business divisions on their market data usage
column2: • Assist in the projects to optimize financial data usage throughout the group
column3:
• Work on specific market data related projects, tasks and requests.


    • YOUR PROFILE

    • Bachelor degree or higher
column4: • A keen interest in data, more specifically financial market data
column5: • Exceptional analytical abilities, including the interpretation of large data sets and deciphering the findings into clear messages and visuals
column6: • Strong MS Excel skills and Tableau is preferred, and experience using SQL and VBA
column7: • Collaborative team player with the ability to work independently
column8: • Ability to take ownership of tasks from the beginning through to conclusion
column9: • Meticulous, proactive and able to multi-task
column10: • Fluent in English and French
column11:
• Resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate to Switzerland.



    • Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


    As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


    It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

3974337014,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analytics-zurich-switzerland-at-jobs-via-efinancialcareers-3974337014?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=9joup5Jv%2B1dOGLH6%2FYHQAQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Internship - Data Analytics (Zurich, Switzerland)",Jobs via eFinancialCareers,"Zug, Zug, Switzerland","What It's About
We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months
The main tasks will be the following:
Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards.

Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication & mapping logic to be applied during data integration & mastering.

Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.
Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree
Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory
Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills
Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task
Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed
Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms
Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers
Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All genuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com

What It's About

We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months

The main tasks will be the following:

  • Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards.
  • Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication &
column2: mapping logic to be applied during data integration &amp
column3:
mastering.
  • Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.


    • What We Expect

    • Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree
    • Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory
    • Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills
    • Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task
    • Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed
    • Proficiency in English is required


    What We Offer

    • Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms
    • Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers
    • Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training


    www.partnersgroup.com

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Big Data & Cloud Technologies.
Expertise and hands-on experience on Python ‚Äì Must Have
Expertise knowledge on SparkQL/Spark Dataframe ‚Äì Must Have
Good knowledge of AWS and AWS Glue ‚Äì Must Have
Good knowledge of SQL ‚Äì Good to Have

Good Knowledge of one of the Workflow engine like Oozie, Autosys ‚Äì Good to Have

Selected candidate will work on Data Warehouse modernization projects and will responsible for the following activities.
Develop programs/scripts in Python/Java + SparkSQL/Spark Dataframe or Python/Java + Cloud native SQL like RedshiftSQL/SnowSQL etc.
Data ingestion from source to target platform
Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.

We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.
We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.
Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.
Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.
Work on solving real-life business problems using next-generation technologies. The quality and content of the job you do here is exceptional and helps you learn and grow fast
Learn while you Grow - You continuously learn and upgrade your skills. Get hands on learning through our unique training and development program.
We are on a mission to enable 100% of our Engineers on cloud
We are growing exponentially and looking for more than 100% growth in 2024
We are a people first company, and our work culture is the primary reason ‚Ä¶why more than 25 % of our employees have been with us for more than ten years.
If you are looking for Career growth and stability, this is the place for you.
You will have the opportunity to work with the smartest brains who have been thought leaders/authors contributing to the tech world.

Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Big Data &
column2:
Cloud Technologies.


Must have technical Skills

  • Expertise and hands-on experience on Python ‚Äì Must Have
  • Expertise knowledge on SparkQL/Spark Dataframe ‚Äì Must Have
  • Good knowledge of AWS and AWS Glue ‚Äì Must Have

  • Validation of scripts

About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.

We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.

We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.

Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.

Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.


Why Impetus?


Work on solving real-life business problems using next-generation technologies. The quality and content of the job you do here is exceptional and helps you learn and grow fast

Learn while you Grow - You continuously learn and upgrade your skills. Get hands on learning through our unique training and development program.

We are growing exponentially and looking for more than 100% growth in 2024

We are a people first company, and our work culture is the primary reason ‚Ä¶why more than 25 % of our employees have been with us for more than ten years.

If you are looking for Career growth and stability, this is the place for you.

3966995046,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-lhh-3966995046?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=UHa5ziDaAS6ZGaA0k8GwCw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,LHH,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Our client is a Non profit organisation based in Geneva. To strengthen their team, they are looking for a Data Analyst.

This detailed list outlines the responsibilities for a role leading the Office of Inspector General's (OIG) case intake activities within the Analytic and Transformation team of the Professional Services Unit.
Lead the screening and assessment of allegations, determining their credibility, verifiability, and materiality.
Propose appropriate OIG responses based on the assessment.
Obtain, assess, and utilize intelligence from various confidential sources, including case intake, oversight investigations, financial information, and external stakeholder data.
Prepare assessment outcomes for whistleblowers and referral memos for the Secretariat and external agencies.
Engage with whistleblowers to gather information supporting assessment conclusions.
Ensure consistent and timely delivery of work by Case Intake Analysts, in line with SOPs.
Report cases with significant risks to the Analytics & Transformation Manager.
Use case intake outcomes to create presentations highlighting key fraud risk trends, providing qualitative and quantitative insights.
Present these analytics to OIG Management and the Secretariat.
Monitor regulatory developments and industry trends to enhance the OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud program.
Contribute to the development of OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud strategy and workplan using intelligence from case intake activities.
Represent the OIG in panels, meetings, and with external stakeholders on intelligence and investigation case management matters.
Prepare and lead case intake and assessment training sessions for various divisions and units.
Coordinate strategic analysis initiatives, such as investigations and intelligence data analytics, with the Manager of Analytics and Transformation.
Provide support for special projects, acting as a focal point for Case Intake in system redesign efforts.
Conduct effective onboarding and ongoing capacity building for team members.
Validate and control the screening assessment outcomes of Case Intake Analysts before submission to senior management.
Act as a role model, promoting collaborative relationships within the organization.
A university degree in a related field, or a first-level university degree with relevant academic qualifications and experience in a related area, or
Significant relevant experience at a national or international level in lieu of the above academic qualifications.
Professional qualifications and/or training related to investigations and/or intelligence.
Understanding of the Global Fund‚Äôs business model and OIG‚Äôs activities.

Strong experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst, working on complex criminal and/or administrative investigations in fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
Proficiency in using intelligence tools and methods for analytical tasks, including analysis and investigation databases, free text retrieval applications, and analytical products.
Proven ability to create and maintain effective liaison between key internal and external stakeholders.
Experience in providing high-quality written and verbal summary-level analyses and a range of intelligence products.
Over 5 years of experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst in the area of fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
Experience working with multiple sectors, such as international organizations, governments, civil society, and the private sector.

Our client is a Non profit organisation based in Geneva. To strengthen their team, they are looking for a Data Analyst.

This detailed list outlines the responsibilities for a role leading the Office of Inspector General's (OIG) case intake activities within the Analytic and Transformation team of the Professional Services Unit.

  • Lead the screening and assessment of allegations, determining their credibility, verifiability, and materiality.
  • Propose appropriate OIG responses based on the assessment.
  • Obtain, assess, and utilize intelligence from various confidential sources, including case intake, oversight investigations, financial information, and external stakeholder data.
  • Prepare assessment outcomes for whistleblowers and referral memos for the Secretariat and external agencies.
  • Engage with whistleblowers to gather information supporting assessment conclusions.
  • Ensure consistent and timely delivery of work by Case Intake Analysts, in line with SOPs.
  • Report cases with significant risks to the Analytics &
column2:
Transformation Manager.
  • Use case intake outcomes to create presentations highlighting key fraud risk trends, providing qualitative and quantitative insights.
  • Present these analytics to OIG Management and the Secretariat.
  • Monitor regulatory developments and industry trends to enhance the OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud program.
  • Contribute to the development of OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud strategy and workplan using intelligence from case intake activities.
  • Represent the OIG in panels, meetings, and with external stakeholders on intelligence and investigation case management matters.
  • Prepare and lead case intake and assessment training sessions for various divisions and units.
  • Coordinate strategic analysis initiatives, such as investigations and intelligence data analytics, with the Manager of Analytics and Transformation.
  • Provide support for special projects, acting as a focal point for Case Intake in system redesign efforts.
  • Conduct effective onboarding and ongoing capacity building for team members.
  • Validate and control the screening assessment outcomes of Case Intake Analysts before submission to senior management.
  • Act as a role model, promoting collaborative relationships within the organization.

    • Profile:

    • A university degree in a related field, or a first-level university degree with relevant academic qualifications and experience in a related area, or
    • Significant relevant experience at a national or international level in lieu of the above academic qualifications.
    • Professional qualifications and/or training related to investigations and/or intelligence.
    • Understanding of the Global Fund‚Äôs business model and OIG‚Äôs activities.
    • Strong experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst, working on complex criminal and/or administrative investigations in fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
    • Proficiency in using intelligence tools and methods for analytical tasks, including analysis and investigation databases, free text retrieval applications, and analytical products.
    • Proven ability to create and maintain effective liaison between key internal and external stakeholders.
    • Experience in providing high-quality written and verbal summary-level analyses and a range of intelligence products.
    • Over 5 years of experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst in the area of fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
    • Experience working with multiple sectors, such as international organizations, governments, civil society, and the private sector.

3973725126,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-assistant-vlbi-data-analysis-at-amt-f%C3%BCr-informatik-und-organisation-des-kantons-bern-kaio-3973725126?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=PHX9bOsrxkfNGinrtUDHGg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Research Assistant (VLBI Data Analysis),Amt f√ºr Informatik und Organisation des Kantons Bern (KAIO),"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","100%
The Satellite Geodesy research group of the Astronomical Institute of the University of Bern (AIUB) offers the position of a Research Assistant.
The focus of the activities will be in the field of extending the capability of the Bernese GNSS Software package for VLBI Data analysis.

Based on the initial developments related to observation handling and the combined processing of satellites with quasars the full capability of an analysis center of the IVS (International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astronomy) shall be established using the Bernese GNSS Software package. This development shall be carried out in a close cooperation with BKG (Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, Frankfurt am Main, Germany). The activity is established within the framework of the institutional collaboration: ‚ÄúCenter for Orbit Determination in Europe (CODE)‚Äù. A refinement of the observation modelling is still needed. At the same time, the robust data processing procedure shall be developed allowing a highly automated VLBI data analysis. The development is supported by IAPG at TUM (Institute of Astronomical and Physical Geodesy
column2: Technical University of Munich) where an initial prototype implementation was established.

column1: The development shall allow in future research in the field of a combined analysis of VLBI and GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems) measurements ‚Äì in particular preparing the GENESIS mission. It is of course intended that the successful candidate shall start with scientific experiments in that field with the available functionality.

The candidate is expected to have successfully completed the master thesis (diploma / ‚ÄúLizentiat‚Äù) preferably in astronomy, geodesy, physics, or a related topic. Experience in VLBI and/or GNSS data processing or in using the Bernese GNSS Software package, and in computer science (coding in modern Fortran, C++, or perl) are not a requirement, but an advantage. The candidate should be able to speak and write English fluently.
The candidate should start working in Bern as soon as possible.
The position is scheduled for three years. It can be extended depending on the progress in the project.
The salary follows the guidelines of the University of Bern and depends on the qualification of the successful candidate.
Applications (including CV, University Diploma Copies, Possible References) Should Be Received As Soon As Possible But No Later Than August 09, 2024 At The Following Address
Informal enquiries may be obtained at the above address as well.
The University of Bern is an equal opportunity employer and encourages in particular women to apply for open positions.

100%

The Satellite Geodesy research group of the Astronomical Institute of the University of Bern (AIUB) offers the position of a Research Assistant.

The focus of the activities will be in the field of extending the capability of the Bernese GNSS Software package for VLBI Data analysis.

Tasks

Based on the initial developments related to observation handling and the combined processing of satellites with quasars the full capability of an analysis center of the IVS (International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astronomy) shall be established using the Bernese GNSS Software package. This development shall be carried out in a close cooperation with BKG (Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, Frankfurt am Main, Germany). The activity is established within the framework of the institutional collaboration: ‚ÄúCenter for Orbit Determination in Europe (CODE)‚Äù. A refinement of the observation modelling is still needed. At the same time, the robust data processing procedure shall be developed allowing a highly automated VLBI data analysis. The development is supported by IAPG at TUM (Institute of Astronomical and Physical Geodesy
column2:
Technical University of Munich) where an initial prototype implementation was established.

The development shall allow in future research in the field of a combined analysis of VLBI and GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems) measurements ‚Äì in particular preparing the GENESIS mission. It is of course intended that the successful candidate shall start with scientific experiments in that field with the available functionality.

Education

The candidate is expected to have successfully completed the master thesis (diploma / ‚ÄúLizentiat‚Äù) preferably in astronomy, geodesy, physics, or a related topic. Experience in VLBI and/or GNSS data processing or in using the Bernese GNSS Software package, and in computer science (coding in modern Fortran, C++, or perl) are not a requirement, but an advantage. The candidate should be able to speak and write English fluently.

The candidate should start working in Bern as soon as possible.

The position is scheduled for three years. It can be extended depending on the progress in the project.

The salary follows the guidelines of the University of Bern and depends on the qualification of the successful candidate.

Application

Applications (including CV, University Diploma Copies, Possible References) Should Be Received As Soon As Possible But No Later Than August 09, 2024 At The Following Address

Prof Dr. Rolf Dach

Leiter Satellitengeod√§sie Gruppe

Astronomisches Institut

Universit√§t Bern

Sidlerstrasse 5

CH-3012 Bern

Phone: ++41 31 684 85 93, E-mail: rolf.dach@unibe.ch

Informal enquiries may be obtained at the above address as well.

The University of Bern is an equal opportunity employer and encourages in particular women to apply for open positions.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Legal Notice

3971191049,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/global-master-data-business-analyst-switzerland-at-acquism-sarl-3971191049?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=vL1Ao5y8S%2FfdahwFpmNqVA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Global Master Data Business Analyst - Switzerland,Acquism SARL,"Visp, Valais, Switzerland","Global Master Data Business Analyst

The Global Master Data Business Analyst (Global Master Data Professional) is responsible to implement several steps of a program to improve the Master Data Quality and Compliance in quality and material and management (QM and MM SAP Modules). The program contains the definition of the Governance, define and implement a global process, define the authorization concept and ensure the necessary training and documentation.

In addition to this, Global Master Data Business Analyst represents the Global Master Data team in global key projects for the modules. This is a global role that supports all businesses and sites globally. The interaction with stakeholders from different departments (Supply Chain, QA, Procurement, IT) is prerequisite for this position.
Implement a multi-level program (Governance, Data Model, Process, Organization, Tools, Authorization, Consistency checks and live cycle, build network) in a specific module.
In related domains, the Global Master Data Business Analyst gather the necessary knowledge and keep it up-to-date to make sure business processes and reports are optimal supported.
The analyst is responsibility to set the right priorities in the modules and make sure the influence on other systems and modules as well as on processes and reports is checked.
Make sure the right stakeholders are part of the discussions and enables to come up with optimized solutions.
Deal with escalations and challenges that is escalated from his stakeholders or the business or the enabling functions.
In some cases, the Global Master Data Business Analyst also leads virtual global teams.
What You Need To Carry Out This Job
You have a degree in business administration (KV) or a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, mathematics, business information technology or business administration.
You have experience in data management and data analytics tools.
You are fluent in English. German and any additional language will be an appreciated asset.
You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.
Once we receive your CV and a covering letter we will review your application. Due to the high volume of applications, we will only contact you if you are shortlisted for the role.

Global Master Data Business Analyst

Switzerland

The Global Master Data Business Analyst (Global Master Data Professional) is responsible to implement several steps of a program to improve the Master Data Quality and Compliance in quality and material and management (QM and MM SAP Modules). The program contains the definition of the Governance, define and implement a global process, define the authorization concept and ensure the necessary training and documentation.

In addition to this, Global Master Data Business Analyst represents the Global Master Data team in global key projects for the modules. This is a global role that supports all businesses and sites globally. The interaction with stakeholders from different departments (Supply Chain, QA, Procurement, IT) is prerequisite for this position.

  • Implement a multi-level program (Governance, Data Model, Process, Organization, Tools, Authorization, Consistency checks and live cycle, build network) in a specific module.
  • In related domains, the Global Master Data Business Analyst gather the necessary knowledge and keep it up-to-date to make sure business processes and reports are optimal supported.
  • The analyst is responsibility to set the right priorities in the modules and make sure the influence on other systems and modules as well as on processes and reports is checked.
  • Make sure the right stakeholders are part of the discussions and enables to come up with optimized solutions.
  • Deal with escalations and challenges that is escalated from his stakeholders or the business or the enabling functions.
  • In some cases, the Global Master Data Business Analyst also leads virtual global teams.

What You Need To Carry Out This Job

  • You have a degree in business administration (KV) or a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, mathematics, business information technology or business administration.
  • You have experience in data management and data analytics tools.
  • You are fluent in English. German and any additional language will be an appreciated asset.
  • You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.

Once we receive your CV and a covering letter we will review your application. Due to the high volume of applications, we will only contact you if you are shortlisted for the role.

3982322983,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-12-months-home-based-remotely-digital-data-analyst-ses-individual-giving-pfp-geneva-at-unicef-3982322983?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=tO8c9s4EzQSlKsCuN3Y9NQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Consultant (12 months, Home-based, Remotely), Digital Data Analyst (SES), Individual Giving, PFP, Geneva",UNICEF,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","UNICEF works in some of the world‚Äôs toughest places, to reach the world‚Äôs most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.
Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.

UNICEF seeks to hire a talented Data and Analytics expert in order to analyse the performance of UNICEF's online fundraising efforts, by creating audience centric dashboards and developing predictive models and machine learning techniques to support other teams to improve their analytic capabilities and increase their revenue streams. They will be working primarily with digital data in Google Big Query and Microsoft Azure environments and use cloud applications to connect all our data sources and activate with AI, use pre-built and custom ML models for audience targeting measurement and run real time analytics to optimise performance and improve our digital customer journey.

You will provide analytics direction on digital fundraising campaigns, with a focus on improving donor experience, while managing and enhancing our global digital measurement. You will also be part of a growing, multi-faceted analytics, data and insights team that develops advanced analytic solutions for our markets across the globe.

We want to combine our deep media platform knowledge, analytics expertise and sharp fundraising acumen to understand the drivers of performance, with a goal to improve our revenue by 3X in the next 2 years.
This role will be a key asset for the global Digital Fundraising team, contributing‚ÄØsubstantially towards‚ÄØits‚ÄØdigital‚ÄØrevenue‚ÄØgrowth, taking‚ÄØdigital fundraising to an advanced level.
How can you make a difference?
You will be responsible for developing machine learning and analytic solutions, to help improve the end-to-end donor experience.
Own and manage Digital Analytics (Google Analytics), and Media Analytics and generating business intelligence.
Ensure Data Integrity, Accuracy, and Tagging as per best practices and global standards.
Understand multiple data sources and develop methodology for joining data to relevant use cases.
Contribute to building effective process management, quality checks, and reducing product & execution inefficiencies .
Identify gaps, architect solutions and provide optimization recommendations that drive digital fundraising campaigns and objectives.
Deliver end-to-end ML models, performance dashboards and ROI analysis, leveraging media, behaviour and performance data.
Translate data into human insights and stories that drive change in digital fundraising strategy and tactics.
Work closely with leading media partners such as Google, Facebook, TikTok and other data partners to take advantage of new measurement features (FB CAPI, Google ADH) and learning opportunities.
Work with various internal stakeholders to ensure projects are completed in a timely manner.
Stay in touch with market needs and industry trends to identify pain points and gaps.
Be responsible for Quality and timely deliverables for team requests.
Document best practices and seek out opportunities to improve existing processes.
Provide thought leadership and guidance in the development of market-facing presentations and results read-outs.

Develop analytic solution that enhances audience targeting capabilities in markets by using paid media and web analytics data, financial/payment data, qualitative research data and CRM data sources in UNICEF PFP.

Deliver Retention related performance Analysis and recommendation report/dashboard, consisting of an analysis of our donors profile, relevant campaign performance, on various platforms such as search engines, and paid media channels covering the performance metrics such as Pledge ratio, Conversion rates, MRR.
Maintain and further enhance our current Marketing Mix Model in Vertex Ai.
Pledge Donors Acquisition Report - Consisting of conversion rate Pledge Donors, CPA, and ROI.
Knowledge & Best Practices Sharing - identifying, sharing, and replicating all successful case studies in markets.
Deliverable 1: by the end of Aug 2024
Data enhancement analytic solutions are delivered via a dashboard that gives a full donor360 view where we can see the relationship of our campaign efforts linked to financial insights.
Deliverable 2: by the end of October 2024
Scale a web and email dashboard in all SES markets ensuring standardisation and consistency across different markets.
Create a data model that can then be implemented in any market via dataform by using donor360 data sources (web, paid, email, CRM data) and scale our Donor360 dashboard into 3 markets.
Deliverable 3: by the end of December 2024
Launch the MMM program in 2 more markets and maintain existing 2 markets.
provide a range of hypothesis generation that aim at incremental revenue increase via an experimentaiton program.
Deliverable 4: by the end of April 2025
Data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support in-market acquisition and retention efforts, are developed and maintained.
Launch the Donor 360dashboard in Uruguai market.
Launch the Donor 360 dashboard in 2 extra SES markets.
Create a scalable data model for donor 360 in SES markets.
Deliverable 5: by the end of July 2025
Work with the SES and local market team to ensure adoption of the email and donor360 dashboard for data informed campaign measurement.
Conduct local training with 10 up to 14 markets on the SES platform.
Provide a webinar of the Donor 360 dashboard for future SES Market.

There is a possibility of travel to Country offices during the assignment on a per need basis and this will be paid by UNICEF, will be covered separately by UNICEF and not included in the lump sum fee
To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have‚Ä¶

Advanced university degree (Master's degree or higher) in Marketing, Communications, Fundraising, Business Administration, or other related areas is required. Alternatively, a first-level university degree (Bachelor's degree or higher), in combination with an additional qualifying 2 years of relevant experience, may be accepted in lieu of an advanced university degree.

A minimum of five (5) years of relevant professional experience in analytics, marketing, advertising, or communications with a specific focus on developing data and analytic products for digital marketing and retention campaigns or equivalent is required.
At least 3 years of hands-on knowledge of Google Analytics, working on Google Big Query environments is required.
Have experience in implementing and managing Google Analytics for large brands (GA360) is required.
Hands-on experience of building complex dashboards is required.

Experience working with paid media and Salesforce core and SF marketing cloud data, including but not limited to DCM data, Google analytics 360 data, QA and data validation in warehouse environments, data studio, power BI blending and visualization techniques is required.
Experience using any of Looker Studio, PowerBI, Data Studio is mandatory.
Experience working directly with business users to build reports, dashboards and solving business questions with data is an asset.
Experience designing and measuring audience-based tests is required.
Prior experience in a UN organization is desirable.
Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of an additional UN language is desirable
Experience in working with JIRA will be an asset.
Understanding of relational databases and audience-based platforms is an asset
Ability to write SQL queries, doing cohort analysis, comparative analysis etc, is an asset.
The ability to lead own projects and work independently once given a direction is an asset.
Understanding about GA4 360/Big Query/Data Activation/Data Models/Data Pipelines is required.
Understanding the media ads tracking principle as well as the cross-platform data integration technology is an asset.

Please indicate your all-inclusive (lump sum) fees in USD against the deliverables listed above. If there is a need for business travel, the travel costs will be covered by UNICEF separately. The office selects the individual based on best value for money.

Payment of professional fees will be based on submission of agreed deliverables. UNICEF reserves the right to withhold payment in case the deliverables submitted are not up to the required standard or in case of delays in submitting the deliverables on the part of the consultant.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.

Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered ‚Äústaff members‚Äù under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF‚Äôs policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.

The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully-vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.
UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS). ‚ÄØ
To view our competency framework, please visit‚ÄØ here. ‚ÄØ

UNICEF is here to serve the world‚Äôs most disadvantaged children and our global workforce must reflect the diversity of those children. The UNICEF family is committed to include everyone, irrespective of their race/ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, socio-economic background, or any other personal characteristic.

UNICEF offers reasonable accommodation for consultants/individual contractors with disabilities. This may include, for example, accessible software, travel assistance for missions or personal attendants. We encourage you to disclose your disability during your application in case you need reasonable accommodation during the selection process and afterwards in your assignment.

UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. UNICEF also adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.

Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.

And we never give up.

Hobson Prior is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Hobson Prior is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

By providing your details and submitting this form you confirm you have read and understood our privacy policy. We only share your personal details with our group companies at acaciumgroup.com/affiliates and those categories of third parties in our privacy policy at hobsonprior.com/privacy-policy.

Hobson Prior is seeking a Statistician for a contract role based in Basel. The successful candidate will focus on non-clinical statistical work, including data analysis related to quality control and development of synthetic molecules. This role offers a hybrid working model.

Please note that to be considered for this role you must have the right to work in this location.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyzing data related to quality control processes.
  • Contributing to the development of synthetic molecules through statistical analysis.

Requirements

  • A PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, or Pharmaceutical Sciences.
  • Proficiency in R programming.
  • Experience in statistical analysis.

Apply now
